description:
This place literally transforms throughout the night. Came in the evening around 5, it was most empty, chill with a few people drinking. The ambiance nice. Mostly the decor is extremely unique with different piñatas hanging from the ceiling and random painted portraits of animals behind the bar. It's literally the best place to get distracted and drink.

Then by 7, things really picked up. The candles on the table suddenly made things feel intimate as the sun went down. You could snag a comfy booth or a nice table. AND best part was live musicians came in to serenade everyone! A guitarist and two different bands, mariachi?, came and each was better than the last. Great for drinks, dates, and hanging out!
author: Liz B.

description:
Latin has the strongest margaritas you'll find throughout San Francisco. A tall margarita is more than enough to get a woman wasted. OK so I got my margarita, I noticed it was extremely strong so I asked one of the bartenders to top off the glass with sweet and sour, lemonade or something else. Not only it took like 10 minutes to get my drink back, but the bartender had no better idea than pouring real orange juice in the drink.

I left this place wondering what was this person thinking of when he decided to ruin a margarita by adding fresh squeezed orange juice.
author: Melody C.

description:
I hate margaritas and yet somehow liked this place's. I think that's the best TL;DR I could give. 

The vibe is pretty funky, with dim lighting and wild piñatas flying over your head. When I went, there were tons of birthdays, and an overall young crew.

Surprisingly, finding a table wasn't hard for my group of three, and we definitely enjoyed the night before heading out to the next location.
author: Manuela R.

description: STRONG margs. Literally exhaled pure EtOH...enjoy responsibly.
author: Allie L.

description:
This place is a gem! Not only can you get a fantastic fresh margarita, it will also pack a punch! I had two margaritas and was starting to get a little tipsy! 

The bartenders were great and super attentive, they even pointed out bar seats that were opening since my friend and I were not both able to sit. Also, the bartenders are pros the margs were bomb. 

They have a variety of drinks and a full liquor cabinet but after the first margarita I was sold. It is cash only but they do have an ATM. The place is also in a great location of the Mission. Definitely will be back there again, I can't wait to take more friends!
author: Stephanie A.

description: Good bargain for cocktails and welcoming. Always a favorite when not having a direction on where to go for drinks.
author: Shaw L.

description:
A decent neighborhood dive. Despite the name, the only things Latin about this place are the name, décor, and margaritas. Otherwise, the crowd is a gentrified West Bay affair.

As for the drinks, the margaritas are indeed the way to go, and although somewhat spendy, are at least quite strong. It's cash only here, plus there's no food, but it's still worth a visit as part of a larger Mission bar and restaurant crawl.
author: Vincent L.

description:
If you want to get fucked up quick with cheap tequila in an overpriced margarita, go here. 

Cash only spot with hardly anywhere to sit. 

It almost seems like everyone here is on a tinder date so when I'm dragged here, I end up people watching till we head to Brunos or somewhere out of the mission. (lol)
author: Erika D.

description:
A dive bar that refuses to change anything and therefore keeps its unique neighborhood charm. 

Walk into the dimly lit bar and look up at the assortment of piñatas left over from someone's birthday party in the 90s. 

Head to the bar and order a huge margarita then head towards the stage and step up to an open table. It's the best seat in the house to people watch and enjoy your drink.
author: Mitzi G.

description:
A very young hip vibrant colorful fun location.

It's got everything San Francisco promises along with strong drinks.

I walked around the neighborhood to take photos it's cool.
author: Peter K.

description: Went here with some friends, we ordered drinks and found out they where cash only. We tried to get cash but the ATM was broken, so we decided to go somewhere else. While we where trying to figure out where to go the bar tender comes and yells at us, for ordering drinks and not paying (that we obviously left at the bar and didn't deink). We explain that the ATM was broken, he was taken off guard for a second but then just kept yelling. Lol most definitely my least favorite bar experience haha
author: Abby G.

description: The service is absolutely terrible. The bartenders act as if it is a privilege for us to be patronizing the bar. I've been twice now and they have been rude and hostile to my friends. I would never go back or waste my time patronizing this bar.
author: Timothy V.

description:
So like if you wanna get real turnt, come here. I had two margaritas and I am reallllllllllllll good right now. Like as I type. 

And it's only $12???????

Even if the place is crowded. Cmon. You'll never get a better deal. This is your start to a crazy/good night, and probably all you need. Ayyyyyy
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Bartenders were incredibly rude. I was very friendly and apologizing about the fact that my friends had cash and would pay in 5 minutes while I waited at the bar ... I'm rarely that person but wondered
If I was the only one they harassed bc I was the only black person. Sorry, I'll never come back :(
author: Savannah G.

description: This place wasn't expensive, but it has nearly doubled their prices. $14 for a margarita with virtually no alcohol? And by the way, they only take cash and the ATM inside has insane fees. If you are gonna visit this bar I strongly recommend you to bring cash.
author: Mariana C.

description:
If yelp allowed one word reviews- Margaritas. 

It's cash only which is a disappointment. They have decent number of tables and their service is fast. I would definitely recommend this place for a casual hangout. 

Interesting decor.
author: Arjan N.

description: Wow! These margaritas are STRONG and good. One of them and you'll get a good buzz, two and most would start getting more drunk. Bartenders are down to earth and the venue is casual. Perfect for a round of drinks and conversation. It's cash only! Pro tip: Bring in some pizza or loaded nachos from the two venues across the street and ENJOY!
author: Mikey J.

description:
Everyone needs to come here, whether it be pre game or to end your night (in a blackout). Their margaritas are deadly, brings me back to the good 'ol college days... except that we were too broke to afford tequila ingredients. I meant as far as a great buzz for your buck.

Presentation 5/5:
I've never been inside a bar that had a layout or decorations specifically for the Latino culture, Asian culture, or any culture for that matter. So it was a bit interesting... There were piñatas hanging from the ceiling, quotes littered the walls, and weird (creepy) dolls chilling all over the place. Very very cool atmosphere, busy on a Friday Night.

Customer Service 5/5:
Laid back vibes all around. Usually, when you walk into a cash only bar and attempt to pay with card, they respond with something along the lines of:
"Cash only...if you can read."
The gentleman behind the bar was courteous, with thank you and pleases. Can definitely see why people come here (besides the deathmargarita). If the bartender is cool, then that's where you want to be.

Food:
No food here, but the drinks are fantastic. The margarita's alcohol to juice ratio is at least 4/5ths of the glass. And that varies with some getting more. Honestly, I didn't get one but the group & bartender let me take a picture. Came here to wait for dinner reservations, couldn't end up crawling into restaurant.

Overall, come here if you're looking for a nice drink with a laid back atmosphere. Name is just a theme, definitely getting the margarita next time.
author: Tom P.

description: We really used to like this place for its margaritas and ambiance until we had the rudest bar-tender. This is a cash only place and my friend had exactly 40 dollars. 3 margaritas were 39 dollars so she only had a dollar for tip. After a while more of our friends arrived and the bar tender refused them service because he felt we didn't tip enough. We apologized and offered to withdraw and make up for the tip but he simply said "you had your chance" and ignored us for the rest of the evening.
author: Saya D.

description:
A fantastic bar in Mission. Divy, hip and great people from all walks. 

The margarita is big and fresh with the service just as big. 

Cool vibe on the way to dinner or after. 

You walk in to a huge high ceiling joint that immediately puts you at ease. What your home bar should be. 

I'll be back next trip!
author: Peter I.

description: This was the first bar my boyfriend had been to in SF a few years back. It's pretty quirky, piñatas hanging from the ceiling, candles on the tables. Margaritas are the go to drink. Pretty packed on a Saturday night. Close to the mission and a bunch of other cool spots for drunchies and midnight snacks.
author: Tessa M.

description:
Wasn't really feeling this place. It was a total zoo on a Friday night at 9 pm - getting to the bathroom was an ordeal of politely asking people to move, then shoving by them. Only 2 toilets in a fully-packed bar means the restroom is a pivotal location of socialization and people watching, because you'll be standing in line for the majority of your time there. 

The ambience is very dark, probably to hide the general state of things - ripped up seat cushions, dirty floors and walls. The drinks were poured strong in the way you don't really want a drink to be strong: past the point of drinkability - just a bitter, nauseating mess. 
 
It sounds like I'm describing a dive bar, and it would great it that were the case. Yet, most of the people packing themselves in here were dressed for a night on the town, or on awkward first dates. Eesh. Guys, you could seriously do better than this place. 

If pint-size margaritas are your bag, head up to Casanova Lounge on Valencia. They're half the price, and you won't spend the whole time standing with it shoved up under your chin. Sit back, relax...it's Friday.
author: Laura B.

description: Good and STRONG margaritas!! Cool place, love the decor.
author: Daniella V.

description: Came here with two friends, one from out of town, and as we were considering going in, the doorman started spewing racial slurs at us. Have never had anyone be so rude. Management here must be very lax. Avoid at all costs.
author: Tony L.

description:
When I was wrangled into a trip to Latin American Club, the kicker was these crazy margaritas served in pint glasses. I thought to myself, so what, I've seen a thousand margaritas served in a pint glass. What's the bid deal?

We arrived ill prepared without enough cash amongst the group to collectively purchase one $12 margarita. Kelly S got some cash from the ATM and doled it out to us like kids waiting for ice cream truck money... Thanks Mom! As I waited for my marg, I noticed the bartender pouring an insane amount of booze into this pint glass when I realized that pint glass was about to be my drink.

She left about an inch and half from the top of the glass and squeezed in a fresh lime them topped it off with triple sec. I thought for sure it would taste as though I was taking shots of Jóse in a dorm room, but it was surprisingly tasty. Not tasty enough to say it was good, but tasty enough that I would get another one if I didn't think I would go to the hospital after.
author: Scotty C.

description:
Wasn't impressed by the drink - strong sure but not really tasty. but the vibe is definitely cool! 

The service was good. When we were there, they played some live music , which made the place fun !

Carry cash, they don't take card!!
author: Suparna J.

description:
This is the kind of bar you go to when you want to get blitzed and wake up the next morning next to a monkey blow-up doll. I am convinced they are trying to kill us all with their margaritas which are roughly 90% tequila and 10% sour mix, all served up in a tall water glass. It's easily 5 drinks for the price of one. For $12, this is one of the better alcohol deals in the city, according to my San Francisco friends. If you're like me, one of these will get you pleasantly tipsy. Two of these will get you black-out drunk. I may or may not have had two....and ended up forgetting most of the night. 

All I remember is that this place is a super chill dive bar that looks like it belongs in Portland. Weird pinatas hang from the ceiling. The place looks like it hasn't been dusted in 30 years. Random mariachi bands will stop by to play and then come around asking for money. And you will more likely than not have a good time.
author: Katie H.

description:
You know that friend with oily hair who doesn't bother to shower, but you don't care because they're super nice? That's Latin American Club. 

Things that come to mind when speaking of Latin American Club:
-Dirty walls, nice bartenders, dive bar, strong drinks, local
-How'd this place get its name? It's far from Latin
-I can't tell if this bar is more on the hipster side or if its got a punk attitude

Overall gist: 
This place is really interesting. It's got interesting décor, an interesting set-up, and interesting bartenders. The word interesting is perceptive. If you're looking for a cute bar for a date, there are more ideal spots in the Mission. If you just wanna grab some dranks with your gals/bros this is an ideal spot. It's not trashy per say, but it's definitely got a grungy personality.

I'm not sure if I'd be back, maybe, possibly depending on who I'm with and the occasion.
P.S: It's cash only, so bring ya ca$$h m0ney.
author: Stefany Z.

description: This was a great little gem in the mission.... They were welcoming, and quick with the drink orders, 5 margaritas (a house speciality), and yes they were very good. It was a friendly easy going environment with good music and good drinks. Seating is scarce but a local patron was kind enough to give up his booth for all 5 of us. Good man!
author: Gabriel L.

description: Fun bar. Cool atmosphere. Kind of crowded. Has a small selection of beers. The piñatas hanging from the ceiling are fun!
author: Kevin S.

description: This place is great for happy hour and late night drinks. They do no have food but they let you bring food in and there is always a food truck outside on Thursday nights. I probably been here 4 times in the last 2 months. Be sure to bring cash! they are cash only and they have a ATM in the back in case you forget or run out. There is also a Wells Fargo down the block on mission. Recommend this place if you want to have a few drinks in a cozy environment.
author: Jan H.

description:
P.S. CASH ONLYY!! 

It has a very Seattle essence to it. Cool decorations, cheap drinks, and a very lively crowd. Great for large groups or even smaller parties. 

I would recommend getting the margaritas here super good and out of this world. If you're making a night out of it I would also check out make-out room and el techo which are within a block of Latin American club.
author: Kunal T.

description:
Wow. This place is in the buzzing Mission district in SF. I went there to meet a couple of friends on a pretty empty stomach around 9:30 pm. We decided to order some margaritas and were fortunate enough to manage a table. My god, the margaritas were the Bomb. By the end of my margarita, I was properly buzzed  ( aided by my empty stomach) . 

Having talked to my friends who live in Mission, this is one of the places where you finish your drinking for the night. Will definitely visit this place whenever I'm in and around the area.
author: Pranav B.

description:
Yes, there's a door hanging from the ceiling. So #quirky.  

And yes, the margaritas come in pint glasses, and won't leave you with sticker shock.  What I did end up with the morning after though, was a rather memorable episode of intestinal distress.

Also the name is weird.  When I was here it was just a bunch of white people.
author: Pernicious J.

description: Cool place for drinks, nice atmosphere and have some killer margarita's - just too expensive. Bothers me that they don't have plastic/cardboard/whatever glasses for you when it's time to close. Plus the smartass bartenders made a couple of inappropriate comments, I'll let those pass this time but next time will make more noise about it.
author: Martino P.

description: ..........Rude and ugly: service, people, place, atmosphere. Welcome to San Francisco. ...........
author: Edie W.

description:
Not much to say that hasn't been said already. But it's common for friends of mine I send here to wake up with a hangover after visiting here, so perhaps some advice will help:

-this bar should be your last of the evening (even if it is your first).
-know your limits; know it's easy to exceed them here without trying too hard.
-bring your dollars, but only enough for your expected limit (i.e. $20 for me-- enough for marg, can o' beer, and pizza on the way home). Your liver will thank me. 

Things I love about this bar:
-efficiency of the beverage, which is key, you can see why below. 
-The margarita is definitely not the best, but it does its job well. 
-places to sit! Cute tables and chairs.
-clearly marked prices on the menu behind the bar-- when I'm running low on cash, do I have a chance to spend the rest of it on a beverage? Yes! 
-Good/bad for groups-- the company is always what I remember most fondly about this bar, but it's hard to talk to more than 1-2 people at a time.

Things I hate about this bar: 
-_too many_ places to sit (it's setup like a diner)-- makes it real hard to get to the bar, or bathroom, or door without shoving people around (or being shoved around, which is also unpleasant). LAC: Take out the tables and chairs next to the bar-- at least on weekends! That can't be safe for fire code, either.
-A popular, but unwise choice for a barhopping night, due to it always being the last bar (but packing a wallop on its own). 
-Maybe I've been coming here too long, but I remember when the margarita was $8. I suppose $12 is somewhat worth the strength/volume of the drink, but it isn't what you'd expect from what is otherwise a dive.
author: Krista L.

description: This place used to be good. Much like everything else in sf these days, it's fallen ill to over charging dumb kids for cheap shitty drinks. $13 for a margarita? Why wouldn't I just go around the corner and buy a bottle? Don't get me wrong I love a good craft cocktail and have no problem paying premium prices where premium prices are deserved.
author: jason p.

description:
Just had a terrible experience at this establishment. So, the story goes: 

I am little drunk and walk up to the bar. Perfectly normal. I casually tell the bartender that I want a beer, modelo, the $3 one. The rude bartender says right in my face "you don't have to talk to me like I'm a retard." - what the fuck? - I couldn't believe how rude this woman was. Here I am, trading my $20 per hour shit wage for alcohol, and I get this shit thrown in my face. I realize that I sound like an asshole, but no. Fuck this. I tried to tell her that I'm drunk and sorry that she interprets my previous wording as offensive. I tell her that I'm a foreigner. She ignores me. 

The bartender, representing the Latin American club, was extremely rude, and frankly, I don't like it. I am not spending anymore money here and I recommend any respectable person, that enjoys liquor, to look somewhere else.
author: Michael W.

description:
Cash only, cool pinatas hanging from the tall ceilings, good drinks (strong margaritas and yummy moscow mules), clean women's bathroom.

We were also able to snag a booth seat while sipping the night away. Crowd is mixed, makes people watching entertaining. It was pretty crowded, but having a seat by the wall removes most of the unpleasantries associated with drunk people pushing and shoving on their way to the bathroom. 

If you want to have fun with strong drinks and no pretentiousness (and have some cash), you'll love this place.
author: Yin H.

description:
Home of the most dangerous margaritas in the West. 

LAC is divey. It has limited seating, and it gets very crowded on Friday nights. But the energy is good, the crowd is friendly, and the margaritas are... uh... let's say they don't skimp on the tequila.

It's always worth stopping by here if you want to kick your night into a higher gear.

P.S. It's cash-only, with an ATM in the rear
author: Andrew R.

description:
Things you need to know about Latin America Club:

+ They have POTENT margaritas (think 3/4 tequila)
+ Music is LOUD and fun
+ It gets absolutely rammed on a Saturday night
+ Having two margaritas is dangerous
+ They have small tables but you might as well just stand
+ Be careful of the margaritas.

Did I mention the margaritas?
author: Jackie D.

description: Hit up the ATM beforehand, it's cash only here. Luckily cash only also means on the cheaper side (~$6/drink). Great place to hang out with friends- isn't normally a shitshow like some of the other bars I can name in the Mission. Bartenders are super friendly- normally only one bartender working at a time so be patient.
author: Arezou A.

description:
Pre-gaming at it's finest.

This bar is a bit of a dump, with little to no atmosphere. It's tiny and crowded. The seating is terrible. They insist on not taking debit cards. Why would you even come here? 

That's easy: the margaritas, which at $12 a pop might seem outrageously expensive for the environment. Then you realize that it's less a margarita and more a pint glass filled with tequila, and it all makes sense. These things are just stupid strong! It's really the best way I've found to get your night in the Mission started. 

One isn't enough, two is too many, and three is just right. Just maybe pin your address to your shirt, so your friends can drag your wasted ass home.
author: Matt E.

description: I like this place, it has good drinks and a nice vibe.  But no straws?  WTF  And those dusty faded-out old pinatas which look like they've been hanging there since the '60s - they really should go away and be replaced.
author: Duane S.

description:
This place is great
It has a nice afternoon vibe and a louder/busier night crowd
Their $12 margaritas are strong and worth the money 

Highly recommend this place is you are trying to get away from the mainstream places in the area
author: Jad A.

description: Overcrowded on weekend nights. Went here on a Friday night and not only did we have nowhere to sit, people were constantly brushing up on us as there is little to no standing room. Margaritas are good, but in my opinion this place is overhyped. If a bar is going to be packed, I'd rather be in a more posh club than at a dive bar.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
This is a pretty cool place. Came here on a Saturday night and it wasn't too full. It's got a laid back vibe to it, and attracts the people looking for the same. It was dimly lit and the music was a bit loud, but those were the only downsides against a bunch of good upsides. Latin music was playing (of course), drinks were cheap and fast, and service was nice and friendly. 

It's refreshing a place like this exists here, considering all the others in the area attracts douchebags and/or hipsters. 

Come for a relaxing and fun time.
author: Phan H.

description: The perfect place for when you're craving a strong marg. Had a wonderful time here getting drinks on a Friday!
author: Allie L.

description: If you want your money stolen, then come here!! The bartender didn't give me my change when I bought the mediocre margarita they're so famous for. I explained to her that no change was left within the time that I placed the twenty there and the time I said something. She refused to here any of it and disengaged. I've lived here for many years and have been here many times. Drinks and people here both suck anyways. I won't be coming back.
author: Jeffrey A.

description:
I suddenly awoke. Where am I? Who am I? My head throbbed in agony. As my eyes focused I recognized my bedroom with a trail of clothes leading to my bed.

My memory started to come back to me, I remember a couple of margaritas and possibly a Long Island ice tea. They didn't seem that strong, but only half way through the first "margarita" I was talking to strangers, making horrible jokes and most likely had lost volume control. Beyond that is fuzzy.

This is place is dangerous, if you want a messy night then you can't go wrong at LAC.
author: Tristan L.

description:
Latin American Club is definitely a hopping place off of 22nd in the Mission. I read a lot about these margaritas on yelp that are served in a pint glass. It's $12 for a margarita, which one would believe is a bit pricey, until you taste it and realize that your pint of margarita is about 75%+ tequila. Let's say that Latin American Club keeps the buzz going (or started, pre-game anybody?) with one of these pints in ya! I wish I started my night here!  

The decor of the place is good too. A bit dark, but with pinatas hanging above you (and not your typical donkey too), this place is quirky and yells San Francisco hip. There is a decent amount of seating at the Latin American Club, but you may struggle to find a spot if it is packed, which for a Saturday night, it is! 

I saw a lot of people try to use plastic here, but this place is a CASH ONLY establishment, but they do have an ATM located on the inside. 

One comment is that on the Saturday night I was here, it was very stuffy and seemed to have poor air circulation. I hope they take some time to get that fixed!
author: Albert H.

description:
Latin American Club doesn't have much of a drink menu, but that's OK because you should really only be here for the margaritas. Well, they call it margaritas but it's actually just a cup full of ice and tequila with a smidget of margarita mix. It's strong, delicious, and will absolutely knock the sober out of you. 

It's closer to the 24th Mission BART station than the 16th Mission station so there's less of a crowd and it's definitely not as turned up but sometimes that's what you want. So sit back and drink margaritas with friends and not deal with the craziness that is 16th Mission BART. There's plenty of chairs and tables- I've never found myself having to stand up while drinking here.
author: Philip W.

description: Great local spot in the Mission to grab a drink and not too loud if you want to catch up with friends. Jeffrey is the coolest most laid back bartender. Bring your own bat if you want to crack open a piñata.
author: Zoom G.

description: Don't have a ton of money but want something strong? Order the margarita, trust me. It's strong as hell and actually doesn't taste bad at all. It's not too sweet and is perfect for sharing if you're with a significant other. My hubby and I usually order a beer each and a margarita and enjoy good conversation in a cool environment. The place is nothing fancy, but that's what I like about it. We love sitting in the booths. Writing about it makes me want to go there now, so hopefully we'll be back soon!
author: Steph L.

description:
LOVE the margaritas here. They are strong and one will get you a good buzz. However, last night's event left a sour taste in my mouth (and it wasn't from the margarita). 

I came here last night and the bartender with short, black curly hair was being shady. I bought one margarita ($12), gave the bartender a $100 bill and I got $8 back. I had to flag her down and I told her "hey, I gave you $100" and she said "oh, sorry" and gave me my correct change. She didn't seem apologetic at all. I'm going to give her the benefit of the doubt and say she couldn't tell the difference between a "100" and "20" because the place is dark. This isn't going to stop me from coming back because I do love this place. I'm warning you, drinks are strong, place is cash only, so make sure you count your change.
author: Cindy A.

description: One word, margaritas!! To die for. $10 for a large glass but they don't use plastic here. So no straws. I started bringing my own,reusable ones. It's a bit too cold without one.
author: MacKenzie B.

description:
Okay, I am guilty. If I'm not at the Makeout Room- I probably walked up the street to this gem.
I am in love with dive bars! 

This is a dive bar... if you want a drink menu- you should not be inside a dive bar (Omg do you even really drink???)

Cash only peeps, know what you want, have a cash ready.

Anyway, absolutely love this place. Good vibes, interesting regulars. The bartenders are off the hook! I really dig Doug and that cute short girl (think her name is Terry or Mary). Drinks are legit!

The crowed is mixed and this place is usually always popping on the weekends, so if you want to have a "conversation" go to a cafe.
author: Jane D.

description:
An update! Second time, same as the first.

These margaritas are like a sweet sweet invitation to the rest of your evening. It's like... oh, I'd love to make this the best night I'll never remember. It's small and packed and if you get a table, awesome. They've upped the price but barely. It's still cash only and you'll have a fabulous time exclaiming over the tequila as faded pinatas slowly whirl above you. 

This is a must stop if you a. like margaritas b. like being drunk or c. are in San Francisco.
author: Kelly S.

description:
One of the most utterly odd and delightful places I've been.

Picture the scene: hunting for somewhere to hang out, Kelly S exclaims that we've just got to try the pints of margaritas at Latin American Club. We're all totally game! It's early enough that there's still a little space to sit (omg!!) so a bunch of CMs shoulder their way through the higgeldy piggeldy tables and chairs to claim a couple of spots. 

The bartender is cheery and friendly, situated behind a giant wooden bar, reminiscent of something you'd see in an old Western; this is exacerbated by the old mirrors behind the bar, and the strange little knick knacks everywhere. 

I opted for the not-a-pint-size after seeing her pour tequila continuously into an ice filled (16oz) glass until there was about an inch and a half to spare, topping it up with lime and triple sec. I'm totally having one next time, but after several nights of drinking I figured a single was a better bet for my abused liver!

Getting back to the table I made the hilarious choice to look up, and discovered a plethora of incredibly creepy pinatas - at least, that's what I worked out they were, they were all so faded it was impossible to tell what was what! I had a great time trying to decipher the strange shapes - one was either an astronaut or a deep sea diver... I'm pretty sure...

In any case, the drinks were decent (and strong), the atmosphere was humming, and I had a great time! I'd definitely return - just make sure you get there earlier enough to get seats.
author: Ayla C.

description:
A night at the Latin America Club was quite fun (and inexpensive). These margaritas are strong, yet somehow not potent with tequila. They're strong enough that I visited on Saturday and wasn't able to write the review until Sunday. 

It really brings back memories of overly drinking at college dive bars. I couldn't exactly see myself being a regular, but it definitely has it's time and place. 

CASH ONLY
author: Matt F.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for a pre-dinner drink on our 4th date. The margaritas are 90% tequila with the tiniest splash of margarita mix. In hindsight, his intentions couldn't have been clearer.... 

Cash only. For the bar too.
author: Xinxin W.

description: The bar is ok. But very small, and they don't have Latin American way.
author: Stella L.

description:
No words.

My review will echo every other review here. I came here on a Tuesday night and had two of the infamous $12 margaritas. Not sure why I had two. The first alone was enough to do me in and in the future, I'll probably stop at one.
author: Geoffrey B.

description: I came here on a Friday night around 10:30pm with 10 people. It was PACKED. We couldn't find a place to sit for about an hour, but we found a place to stand in the meanwhile. Like all the comments say, these margaritas are STRONG. I was already tipsy from dinner, so I could only finish about half the drink. For the amount of alcohol that goes in the glass, the drink is surprisingly tasty (especially once some of the ice has melted). I wouldn't come here regularly, but it's nice to stop by once in a while.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Dark Mission Bar. Pinatas. Margaritas.

This place is pretty cool. The first time I wandered in here because it was packed with people and I thought it must be the place to be! I've come back a few times since and always have a good time. Pretty much any night of the week there is usually a good amount of people there. Weekends get crazy packed, and it seems to be a hot spot for small companies to hit for happy hour-type gatherings. 

Margaritas are delicious (super strong), beer selection is pretty good. The bar is cash only which is extremely common for the mission. It definitely has a hipster vibe and I'm not sure I'd want to see it in the daylight, but a fun neighborhood spot to grab a drink!
author: Mandy A.

description:
it's a love/hate with this place.
Love the $8 margaritas. Definitely get those. they are a good size, super strong. So after 2 you are good to go.
Love that they have a good size bar with enough seating. Chill spot to chat up with friends and get some cheap drinks to start the night.
Hate... Hate, that it gets extremely loud and douche after about 8. Every white person from the marina decides to come here. Not to mention, is there a height requirement or something. Every time I go, there are huge 6'3 guys who are obviously to others, especially a petite girl like me. So unless you have a seat, be prepared to get shoved or someone's arm rest on your head.
I try to avoid the obnoxious people and show up earlier.
Also, it's all CASH only.
author: francis c.

description:
Along with Kilowatt, Dalva, and a few others, this is one of my all-time favorite Mission bars. 

And like most good dive bars, it has a cool vibe, solid bartenders, cheap drinks, unpretentious patrons*, and discretionary hygiene.  I have had many great nights here with friends from the 'hood, mostly mid-week staying out late on a school night.  This is not a place to have a quiet conversation, the place can get pretty raucous (hey, don't you see the piñatas hanging above as a clue?).  One day, I'll find out what's inside those piñatas (I'm sure they're filled with daydreams).

* Bets are off on weekends regarding level of unpretentiousness
author: Saminda W.

description:
This is the traditional final bar to my friends' night out in the Mission. If you do it like we do, you might not remember getting home the next morning.

Latin American Club (or LAC, pronounced "lack") is known for one thing and one thing only: their margaritas. They come in a pint glass and they are mostly tequila. By "mostly" I mean 95%, with some salt on the rim and what must be an extremely concentrated mix on top. You won't notice how strong they are until you're on your second (or third, and Keith M. as I recall made it through four!) 

Then, the room starts spinning, and it's too late to go back. Your world becomes a revolving blur. The tequila consumes you whole and destroys any semblance of control you may or may not be used to enjoying.

You've been warned.

That said, I will be back. Over and over again. Some day I'll learn my lesson.

LAC is crowded, noisy, and cash only. The margaritas are like $11 after tip, but you don't need many of them to really light up your night. If you come with a group of friends, you will have a great time. Folks are really friendly, although they're not Latin American by any stretch... this is another mostly white dive in the Mission.
author: Zach M.

description:
Went here for late night drinks as a stop for our bar hopping. I'm sure it's been brought up before, but Cash Only is king here.

I had the Moscow Mule. Disappointed about not being served in a copper cup, but this doesn't affect the taste, more so presentation. The drink packed a nice punch and at a reasonable price under $10, can't go wrong.

Also probably mentioned before is the decor. The strange pinatas and interesting signs on the wall make this place a nice detour from the typical yuppie bars that can be littered up and down the area. A change of pace from the usual. Will add to one of my stops if I'm in the area, but looks like it could be tough getting a drink on busier nights due to space.
author: Eric L.

description:
Coming here on a late Friday night is probably not the best idea, it was unbelievably packed.. at this point, you are basically standing on top of people. 

Although it was crowded, it was not hard to get a drink - the bartender and I made eye contact and she knew exactly what i wanted, the famous Margarita. This is the drink of the crazies, it is SO strong. Trust me, I watched her make it. Basically the shaker was filled with 15/16th of Tequila and 1/16th of lime juice, she then shakes it up and adds salt. That is it, unless there is more in the tequila that i don't know about.. 
I was scared to try it but i had a sip and you can not taste the tequila whatsoever, but boy it HITS you! 

There are a couple of tables and chairs but it is hard to sit because it gets very crowded, I want to come back here. The decor on the wall is funky and unique. If you're in the mission, stop by and if you're no where near, also stop by. 

WARNING: CASH ONLY but there is an ATM
author: Natasha S.

description:
Great bar, been coming for years. Good selection of beer. One margarita hits the spot, two margarita's your incessantly gushing to your pal's how much you love them, three margarita's send you through a space-time continuum wormhole. Trust me, don't push it with margarita's. 
Read somewhere that this place has no atmosphere. Bulls$%@. Lighting, music, overall ambiance is spot on. Bartender on weeknights (Wednesday!) is very friendly and is a total babe. 
One major downside. On weekends, starting around 10pm, this turns into a techbro sausage festival.
author: J B.

description:
I came to this place last night with a friend and prior to going in, I read the Yelp reviews...which were clearly spot on! They are known for their margaritas which are 75 percent tequila. If not wine, tequila is my next alcohol of choice. 

I was feeling pretty good after having had half a glass. By the time I finished the glass I was good! 11 bucks for a good buzz? Yes, please! 

I took one star away for two reasons. One being; their cash only policy. I don't always have cash on me and I hate nothing more than paying an ATM fee (call me cheap, but those fees add up. No thanks). Two; the fact that they serve margaritas...with no straws?! I mean, it's not even that they don't serve straws with their margs, but they literally don't have any straws...major sad face/let down. I don't want all that sugar going to my teeth. Barf. With all that being said, overall it was a great experience. Bar tender was quick and attentive, she served our order and didn't bother us again! Don't get me wrong, I appreciate being attentive, but some bar tenders just go overboard to the point where it's just plain annoying. 

It was my first time here, but it's definitely not my last time here (only I'll bring a straw with me next time...and cash ;)). I will reco this place to everyone!
author: Kiara E.

description:
Cash only bar - their margarita was worth it though. One was enough to take me there lol. 

Bring friends for sure.
author: Ron C.

description: WARNING: The Margaritas here are huge and strong! Just two or three will lead to quite an entertaining and memorable night. There's only one flavor but they go down so easily and are quite deceiving! This place gets ridiculously crowded on Saturday evenings so come early if you want seats for your group! I suggest a group of max 3 or 4 people because its quite small and gets pretty hard to hear your party. The ambiance is incredibly kitschy with a cheesy Mexican theme of pinatas and sombreros hanging from the ceiling but I love the dive bar feel. Located right in the middle of the Mission, its quite easy to bar hop around with El techo nearby and many great restaurants in the area. Its definitely not the cleanest bar with ripped up seats and a bathroom that looks like its rarely cleaned, but it doesn't pretend to be anything than a fun place to chill after a long workday to start off the night. I always forget that this place is cash only, so be prepared!
author: Lisa H.

description: Get the margarita but please be careful! It's good but a creeper! It was pretty empty when we came, but it was a Sunday so that's probably why.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I bought a painting at a flea market in Revere, MA. It's 3' x 4' and has a Norse viking warrior leading a sled team of polar bears atop his shielded sleigh of might. Shit, thanks Google. Here's a picture:
http://bit.ly/brtOeM

Anyway, for $20, I took that thing home. A mistake, in retrospect. The gods of Awesome Terrible Art should have sexted me the address of Latin American Club, that this monsterpiece could have taken its rightful place beside the aesthetically-inebriated pieces of the LAC Gallery.

Three nights ago, I drank a single $8 margarita - scratch that - a single $8 pint of well tequila and a squeeze of lime, poured by a guy who owns the bar in any movie where Danny Trejo is hired as a hitman.

Aaaaaaaand I'm just now hanging over. Great value! Super kawaii!!
author: Damien S.

description:
Four stars for cheap beers!! 2 for $10.  With fast service, can't really expect much more!  Still, the atmosphere is perfect for some low-key catch-up with friends you haven't seen in awhile.

Some tips: It's cash only, as well as small. Just be prepared.
author: Allison M.

description: We came for the margaritas. We left knowing the margaritas were crazy strong and on point. Can't really go wrong here!
author: Emily K.

description:
I don't get what people see in this bar. In the same night, I was charged three different prices for the "famed" margarita (as an ex-bartender, no, just no). That right there raises red flags. I also asked for a receipt and was refused. I was on business and spending a lot of money, so I felt this was ridiculous (even just a hand-written receipt with six margaritas scribbled on it would have worked). Most of the bars that are cash only in San Francisco (and Los Angeles and New York) have done this for me before. Latin American Club is the only bar I've been to in the city that refused. The crowd can also get pretty disgusting- a mix of hipster douchebags, beta girls who think they're alphas, and general white folks. White people are fine, but when your bar is called "Latin American Club," this is just weird. This isn't a dive bar. This is an overpriced hangout for aging hipsters who've never been to a real dive bar (San Francisco barely has any left, and they certainly are not trendy spots in the Mission). I think the name should be changed to something less offensive. Maybe El Hipster Blanco?

Is it a dive bar? Is it a trendy hangout for hipsters? Or is it just a slap in the face to displaced Latinos in the Mission? I can't really figure it out. All I know is that after the shitty customer service, I won't be going back any time soon. I know I'm not the target market for this place, but there is no excuse for prices being all over the board in the same night (quality was too, and I think the bartender was drunk). The bad crowd could be made up for with good customer service. Like many expensive places in the Mission too cool for school, this place fails to deliver. You are supposed to expect a lot of shallow, tech-addicted, shitty people in the Mission, but this is even worse than the norm.
author: Calvin A.

description:
First I must say they do have some STRONG margaritas, but they are $12 which seems pretty steep or how much ice is in your cup... but they are mighty tasty... my only real beef with this place is the vibe/service. Its WAY too hipster. Everyone is either grunge or pierced all over. If you aren't you dont feel very welcome AND we basically got kicked out on Santacon because they were doing a Poetry reading.... WHO DOES A DAMN POETRY READING ON SANTACON??

Oh ya...


HIPSTERS.
author: Brittini S.

description:
Cool chill bar, not very exciting, lots of strange/interesting decorations, some seating but it can get really crowded.

This place is known for their margaritas, because they are huge, 90% tequila, and only $11. As a three-shot wonder this doesn't really appeal to me (I can't even drink half of one), but I know many of your ears just perked up. So I guess this is a good "pre-game" type of place. Tread carefully. ;)
author: Cynthia W.

description: Classic Mission bar with stiff drinks.  Excellent.  The decor is quirky with piñatas dangling from the ceiling, a giant rat next to the bar, and a rotating selection of art hanging on the walls. It can be mellow around opening time but gets super packed on weekend nights.  Crowds notwithstanding, it makes for a good time.  I can't write a review without mentioning the margaritas.  They are legendary and deserve to be.
author: John H.

description:
Latin American Club is a tiny tiny, old wooden space with agitated bartenders and some pinatas as the only decor. 

Cash only $12 margaritas. Pint glass margaritas. I thought mine wasn't that strong, but I was later hiccuping at the bar at the Make-Out Room across the street - where, shockingly, NO ONE MADE OUT WITH ME, god. 

One of their margaritas is a necessary Mission District experience. So, do it.
author: K M.

description: I'd heard of the infamous LAC..  and the even more infamous margaritas they serve here. OKAY the drinks are strong but they're not THAT strong. It gets crazy crowded but earlier on in the evening it's actually kinda nice, a margarita by candlelight, under those pinatas.
author: Vivian H.

description: A fine little dive bar in the Mission. The booths are great for sitting and chatting. Only issue is it felt a little far from my drinking companion. Good selection and bartender offered free bubble water. A win!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Came here this past Saturday as our second stop for the night. Upon arrival, we got lucky and were able to snag a couple barstools at the far end. While the bartender made our drinks, I was busy looking at all the fun pinatas on the ceiling! The margs were delish, and, unbeknownst to me at the time, REALLY DAMN STRONG. I only realized this as I was halfway through mine, watching the bartender make em for others.. it's pretty much 90% tequila. Sh*t. 

Contrary to other reviews, it does NOT just taste like tequila and lime (and I actually normally hate tequila). As we were finishing up our drinks, it started to get really packed and bros were bumping into me endlessly, so we left for pupusas and somehow made it to two more bars. This was my last clear memory of any conversations that may have been had. Hello, Sunday hangover.

Would definitely come back, it reminds me of a mix between Bar 107 and Cha Cha Lounge in LA. Don't forget your cash!
author: Annie N.

description:
Latin American Club is where good nights out come to abrupt end. Do not even think about going somewhere else to drink after coming here. Don't try to be a hero.

You only come here to get the pint margarita. I used to wonder, "How strong could a margarita possibly be? It's just a margarita" and then I got my LAC cherry popped. This margarita is almost entirely tequila and you get an entire pint of it.

Yup, it's as absurdly strong as it sounds.
Yup, everyone else was right.
Yup, your night will end here.

Sweet dreams.
author: Nikhil S.

description:
$11 buys you Havoc Incarnate aka a LAC margarita. Almost entirely tequila, with a splash of lemon juice, these are sure to guarantee a great night and a miserable morning after. You have been warned. 

You could also get a "single" margarita (as opposed to what I can only assume is a triple or quadruple), for 6 bucks a pop. Not as economical, but less hangover inducing I'm sure. It comes in a short glass, the traditional comes in a pint. 

Ambiance is meh, but after a few sips you won't notice.
author: Claire G.

description:
A bar in SF that serves pint size margaritas that won't hurt your wallet and a decent draft selection also for only $4??? Wow. Latin American Club why had we never met before?

Yup, right in the Mission this place will keep you happy and the people there are all a nice mix of different kinds if you ask me. You have your hey I want to get laid people, the reunion of friends people, the I just need a drink people, etc. It is cash only, but at these prices for their strong drinks you really shouldn't have to go through much cash before you are the happiest you've been in a while. The service is also pretty fast too. 

It is a very laid back spot with decent decor inside, but it is dimly lit which is exactly how I like my bars. It isn't the biggest bar in the world, but because of that it does fill up quite quickly! So come here thirsty and try and get here early if you want to snag an actual table. Once people plop down there, they don't tend to leave! And I mean why would you since the drinks really can't be much cheaper anywhere else.
author: Sarah G.

description: Love this little bar. Amazing Happy Hour ($2 Tecate Cans), awesome margaritas, and you can't beat the ambiance. Definitely recommend.
author: Jane F.

description: I am in awe of how this bar manages to get 18 oz of tequila into a 16 oz Margarita. This bar needs a "double black diamond" warning at the door.
author: k g.

description: This place hasn't changed a bit in 20 yrs. great dive bar! Remember cash only and drink water between drinks....strong drinks! Have fun!!
author: Ramie S.

description:
This place is an absolute winner solely based on the dollars-to-drunkenness ratio of its infamous "margarita". The purported margarita in question is a pint glass full of tequila with a spritz of lime juice. At $8, it's a deadly, delicious steal.

I can't comment on anything else on the bar menu here because I've never been able to resist the siren call of the mondo margarita, at least to the best of my memories (which are highly affected by said margarita).

If you end up here (and you should) don't plan on going anywhere else. You won't remember it and you'll just be putting more distance and time between you and your comfortable bed, which is where you should be going directly after leaving the LAC. (Yes, this place is infamous enough in certain circles to be known by acronym, which acronym elicits a mixture of groans and cheers at its very utterance.)

Absolutely a must-drink for anyone wishing to experience the full force of the Mission's bars.
author: Sam K.

description: Greyhounds: 3/4 cup tequila, 1/4 cup grapefruit juice. What more can I say?
author: Janice P.

description: The margaritas are $12 and the modern day equivalent of Four Loko because they're commonly referred to as "blackout in a can." Realistically though, they are unbearably strong margaritas that are wretched to drink. DISGUSTING. Will not be back.
author: Aly H.

description:
I don't really get the hype of this place, since it's almost always super crowded and that margaritas ARE super strong BUT still pretty pricy considering all you taste is well tequila and lime juice.  I do like the vibe on quieter nights, but then by the time I usually get to this place it's the end of the night and the last ditch marg always puts you in a good mood.

Plus: people here are mostly fun, and if they aren't the bartender will put them in their place.
author: Reyana F.

description:
Went out with a friend of mine after determining we were in the mood for anything that tequila in it. It seemed like the best best to go grab a margarita at the Latin American Club. 

As with most other reviewers you should know a few things before arriving:

1. It gets CROWDED. Be prepared to defend your personal space.
2. CASH ONLY - there is an ATM in back but better to be prepared.
3. The Margaritas are STRONG. Need I say more? ;)

Overall, we had a great night and I look forward to coming back in the future when the timing is right.
author: Jared W.

description: I absolutely love their drinks and atmosphere!  Just the right amount of diviness that everyone needs. Andy (beauty with tats and ponytail) the bartender is the best!!!
author: Meli B.

description:
I call this place the home of the "one and done" margarita. I have yet to meet anyone who has finished even 1.5 margs here. It's the best bang for your buck cocktail in the city. 

Don't be fooled by the name though; it's definitely a bar and not a club. 
My favorite night of the week to come is Thursday because it's busy but not overly crowded. 

LAC (yes my friends even have an acronym for it) is a fun place for groups though seating is limited and it can get pretty crowded on the weekends. 

I'm a fan of the quirky decor and always notice something new I'd missed the time before. This place is far from fancy, but always fun. 

One thing to keep in mind is that this place is cash only (though they do have an atm inside).
author: Tasmin S.

description: This is my go to bar in the Mission. It's unpretentious and chill. And the margaritas -whew! Careful with those margaritas.
author: C O.

description:
Something clicked for me here.

This place is just insanely cozy to me & I felt right at home immediately.

It may have also clicked for me bc they were playing "Damaged Goods" by Gang of Four upon my arrival and that song describes my life situation to a T right now .

The atmosphere, the crowd, the bar tenders & yes...the margaritas all get an A+++

I can't wait to be back, this is my new favorite bar.
author: Zhenya S.

description:
well, i came on a tuesday and liked it.  i had two glasses of water, but my friends were hammered from day drinking.  

love the pinatas and door and random shit hanging from the ceiling.  i have no idea why it's called latin america club though.  there were glittery red chinese lanterns hanging in the back / elevated "stage" part where there is more seating.

margaritas are probably 85% tequila, 15% ice and whatever other shit they put in.  it might even be 90% and 10% respectively, but who the fuck really knows.  i cringed watching my friend drink it as i was sipping my delicious glass of iceless water.

cash only which is annoying as crap, but it's the mission, and it's san francisco, so i wasn't totally surprised.  every single table + every single stool at the bar was taken up on a tuesday night.  if i could choose one word to describe the average patron in the bar... it would probably be hipster.

like all kinds of hipsters.  trendy hipsters, grungy hipsters, older hipsters, younger hipsters, blah blah blah.  i didn't really fit in but whatever.  i'll try to remember to look hobo chic next time.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
You shouldn't go here, because what if you take the last seat at the bar before I get there?

Latin American Club is one of my favorite bars in the Mission. Awesome location (right by my house), great beer selection (they had New Belgium's La Folie on tap last time I was there!), cool crowd (damn dude, where'd you get that shirt?), and happenin'. 

It's a good compromise between "fall asleep chill" and "better get those uppers let's party".
author: Marcus C.

description:
Yes, it's true...crazy strong margaritas served in pint glasses for $8. More Please!! I love this place. It's dark, slightly dingy, with pinatas hanging from the ceiling (my favorite..the drunk elephant head), a large white rat painted on one wall, deer head behind counter, and tables that seem to have been put in as an afterthought.

As others have said the bartenders are not particularly friendly, it's not a cheers type of place. But I'm here for the drinks not the banter with the staff, that's what my bar mates are for.
author: Maria M.

description:
Strong margaritas. I think this is a great place to start your night of drinking, not a place to end. Honestly, $9 for a margarita as big as a beer glass. I'm in. Tons of alcohol. 

Interesting atmosphere. Lots of pinatas hanging from the ceilings.
author: Nina Y.

description: Great place, awesome margaritas! Cheap AND massive AND real' strong. Will definitely go back.
author: Sev G.

description:
As far as "bars suggested by ex-boyfriends" category goes this one totally wins.
Piñatas of questionable characters hanging from the ceiling, awkward first dates to spy on, dirty floors...yes!
May I add margaritas that could even silence a texican?
author: Annalise P.

description: Terrific, no pretense Mission bar. Sometimes life doesn't get much sweeter than a terrific margarita from the place in the neighborhood.
author: J. Mike S.

description:
The margarita is the thing to get here. It was strong for sure, but lots of ice for sure too. It was only a tiny bit of margarita mix, so it didn't taste like much. The selection of beers on tap were pretty standard variety. The stand outs were the Old 38 Stout and Allagash White. The bartenders weren't super duper friendly, just there to serve your drink. The interior is a little dingy with battered, mismatched furniture, but good thing with the high ceilings. There's a handful of tables with lots of chairs scattered about and plenty of standing room. There are 2 restrooms in the back.

Cash Only
author: Jennifer W.

description:
So... I've never been to this bar sober, but I can assure you I've always left feeling ten times better than when I walked in. It could be the super-chill crowd, the piñata filled- southwestern style décor, or the awesome bartenders... but I am pretty sure it's really all the Margaritas. 

Their Margaritas are done PROPER, and when I say proper, I mean they are legit like 3/4 tequila. This place will knock you on your ass if you're not careful. And may I say, as much as I love it, these are not the bathrooms you want to get sick in...

It gets a little crowded on the weekends, but then again, what bar in the Mission doesn't.

All in all this is an awesome place to have a drink. The prices are affordable (you certainly get your money's worth), and it is a great spot to hit up if you're trying to take your night to that next level of crazy-drunken-weirdness.
author: Ashley H.

description:
What do u want when I go drinking in the mission? A place that has great and cheap margaritas. 

I've been here a couple times with my friends on several celebrations and bday occasions. We always have a great time because the drinks are cheap, the decor is no frills and we are getting drunk :)

The margaritas are great here as they fill up a pint glass of tequila about 90% of the way and give you a refreshing splash of lime juice on top. These used to be cheaper bit I think they are $11 now? Still cheap and delicious though :)

It's a great bar that's not too crowded on the weekdays and it's awesome to stop by after having a great dinner at esperpento which is across the st!
author: Christine W.

description: Gross. This place was filled to the brim with loud mouths, sloppy drunks, Polo shirts, and bad manners--not to mention $30 for 2 Schofferhofer and 1 margarita. Couldn't hear my friends talk a foot away from me...unsolicited conversations by style-less young men. No. Just no!
author: Audrey L.

description: Great place for drinks- atmosphere is different not fancy or to loud and rowdy but more casual and yes had a many customers, and it has from musicians walking in and you can bring your dog in with you. The bartender was pleasant and gave us our drinks quickly. The prices were right and he was very splendid with the alcohol in my "Hortinotos Mule" $9.00, he took the time to recommend a beer and pointed out his favorite ones.  The decorations were a mixture of pinatas and paintings, it's interesting but not overwhelming to the eye. A place worth checking out!
author: Erika P.

description:
The place is only "Latin American" because there's Pinatas hanging from the ceiling and they serve margaritas. In all other respects it is just a bar in the Mission. Not that this is a bad thing. The margaritas are $8 but they are strong (basically two drinks' worth of tequila.) The tequila they use for this margarita is Cazadores Blanco and really you could do much worse (Sauza, Cuervo.) I literally didn't try anything else, but based on an $8 drink that could make up most of your buzz, this place is worth 4 stars to me.

P.S. Crowded as hell on a Friday night.
author: Josh K.

description:
Um, I hate to tell you all this but strong doesn't equal good in terms of margaritas. Not until after the first one at least.

Dark bar, scary yet intriguing décor, cash only. Drink at your own risk.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
We stopped into the Latin American Club on a whim while trying to find a place to get a drink before dinner on New Years Eve. It was cool - laid back, cool yet not too pretentious in its quirky design (pinatas anyone?) and the bar staff was some of the friendliest I had experienced in San Francisco. We each had a beer, then went to dinner, then returned to meet a friend before heading to a party. It got rather packed, but, if the turn over rate was fast and we were able to score seats at the bar after waiting about 10 minutes. 

Aside from beer and a full bar, the also had decent wine by the glass and a tasty cava by the single serve bottle. They also have sake. 

I'll take LAC over the other more pretentious Mission bars anytime! 

p.s. it is CASH only and they DO have WIFI.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Sometimes, you just have to make one drink and make one drink really well - queue Latin America Club's margaritas!!

As Nina Y. mentioned, start your night here because you will make many, many bad decisions after drinking their tall tequila concoctions.  Laid back, culturally festive atmosphere.  Not too rowdy so you will be able to hold a  conversation.  Cash only, of course - this is the Mission.
author: Kathleen W.

description: CASH ONLY, vodka and soda $5.
author: Magda G.

description:
I admit, I've only been here the once. But as far as I can tell, this place has at least three awesome things going for it.

1. The margaritas cost $8. Which could be construed as cheap or expensive, depending on where you live. But no matter what, it's worth it here because when they say "margarita" they really mean "pint glass of tequila." 

2. There are piñatas all over the ceiling.

3. It attracts the sort of person that wears an Antoine Dodson* t-shirt. 

So you can run and tell that, homeboy.
____________

*http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hMtZfW2z9dw
author: Peter D.

description:
No name. Just a lit up horseshoe dangling above signals that this place is actually a bar. 

OLE OLE $3 special drinks every night.

AI YAI YAI Margaritas are the best in town. Sombreros down. 

Enjoy one or a few with pinatas hanging above you amongst the other extreme, electic decor. Get offered empanadas from a Chilean with an ice chest and exchange conversations with the divey bunch of 22nd cronies.

Saddle up.
author: Daniella B.

description: Strongest Margs in SF for sure! One of these is plenty. I love this bar - it's small but kind of quirky, and the marg is so strong I only need to buy one drink (usually...). This place gets crowded but there's usually a table or two you can grab. Cash only. Also don't expect any Latin American dancing.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Solid first date bar. The lights are low, the drinks are strong and the music is loud (post 9pm). Weird pinatas on the ceiling add to the divey hipster mission ambiance. Beers are between $4-$6. I steered clear of the margaritas my first time there based on the Yelp reviews and I wanted to keep it classy. 

Close to the 24th st mission bart is an added plus.  Get there early, we went on a Wednesday and it was packed by 9ish.
author: Leah M.

description:
I had a dream once. A nightmare, really. I was inside of a video game. Not the good ones either, I'm talking about the old school Atari 2600 games like Joust and Pac-Man and Space Invaders. Only they were all combined. Lots of weird shapes hovering overhead, strange images on the walls, and a cacophony of noises ringing in my ears.

Not long ago I relived that dream at Latin American Club. The strange images turned from Q-bert and Doug (that's what I always called the little miner in Dig Dug) into dusty pinatas hanging from the ceiling. The walls became giant paintings of chihuahuas or other strange semi-latino-themed subjects.

And the noise. This place can get buzzing. On my Monday night visit it was full, but not crowded. We found a recently abandoned table and sat down. Everyone ordered a margarita (cash only) and they came pretty quick. Being a non-drinker I can only report that the bartender was a little too heavy-handed and no one finished theirs.

Despite the bizarre surroundings, noise and drinks, I actually kind of dug the vibe here. That dreamy/nightmary feeling is kind of fun to visit every so often. I wouldn't make this a regular stop, but it's a different change of pace to keep the routing from getting stale.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Looking for a quiet neighborhood dive bar? Well this ain't it. Every time I've come here (full disclosure: always on weekends) it's been filled to the brim with your standard array of mission folk. It's impossible to hear yourself think in here, which is not why you should be going to bars anyway, so I suppose that's convenient. The bartenders have always been fast and attentive no matter how many people are drunkenly pining for their attention.

Basically I'm only writing this review for one reason though: their margaritas. They are truly a local wonder. How do they pack that much tequila in such a regular-sized vessel? To say that they're strong and a "bang for your buck" is an understatement. THEY WILL GET YOU DRUNK. I wouldn't say they're "good" in the traditional sense, but if you're looking for the bar equivalent of a small liquor store bottle of New Amsterdam you're inconspicuously chugging outside of a club, this is it.
author: Kyle M.

description:
I think we had bad luck with the night we went there: it was a sunday (before a holiday though) and the atmosphere was a little lame even though the place was pretty packed. On the plus side were the cheap drinks (4$ beer and 8$ cocktails) and the fact that you could sit outside on a table with you drink and smoke at the same time which is very rare for the US.

The music was played very low and didnt help to get the party going. The place itself is pretty fascinating however with various random objects having been attached to the ceiling. You can spend some time just wondering about who had the idea to put them up there.

I was told that this club is usually very lively with great music and people dancing and stuff. I was a little disappointed but then again as said it was a Sunday night.
author: Andreas R.

description:
The bartender (this big bald guy, not white but not sure his background) is a DICK! Yes, I said it. He has atttitude! But, my 1 star is for the lack of seating, cheap ambiance, hipster crowd, and horrible wine list. 

They don't even serve wine in wine glasses and you have to beg them for water. The only good thing about this place is it does get crowded but if you look around the crowd isn't really anyone you'd want to really get to know ;)
author: Kathy S.

description: This is the best bar to drink all night without spending much money. When my budget is tight and I still want to go to a place that is below average I know that Latin America is the place. Drinks are about $5 or $6 and they are super strong, sometimes I feel that 3 drinks is the most I can handle at this bar. I do not spend more than $20 to get loaded, by far much cheaper than other bars in the Mission area. The bartenders are great, all of them are cool, they are very attentive and they never make us wait between drink and drink. They are super-fast and even during the busy nights we never have to wait more than 2 or 3 minutes to get our beverages.. I am not surprised to see that this place has become a great hang out in the Mission and now even tourists are visiting the bar often. My favorite drink here is the Long Island Ice tea, I do recommend people not to order more than 2 unless you want to lose it.
author: Stacie P.

description:
I blame the cheap champagne. It was one of those days where I woke up and realized I wanted to die. Could three deceptively small vodka sodas from LAC the night before be the cause? Not exactly, but those three drinks sure did encourage me to engage in thoroughly ridiculous follow-up drinking behavior, hence putting the blame on the cheap champagne (purchased elsewhere). Not pretty. 

Loud. Really loud, crowded, and nowhere to sit, so boo to all that, but I did like the effed-up pinatas that festoon the place like, uh, pinata spirits, maybe? Read Alex S's description of them, for I can't do them justice. He says "terrifying" like it's a bad thing. OK, one of them might have been a bit on par with that strange statue that comes to life to attack Karen Black in Triology of Terror (side note: at the Glore Psychiatric Museum in St. Joseph, MO, there's a whole bunch of copies of that statue made by a patient there).

Cash only. There was one *nice* bartender. The other one initially stood in front of me and ignored me for several minutes as he stared into space and broke the trance to slowly make a drink for someone else. Don't *make* me wave my hand in your face, pal. Don't *make* me be one of those people.

I'd probably like this place a lot more if I were to go earlier in the evening when I would be less prone to "whooping it up."
author: Joi B.

description:
Hell. yes. Especially if you want a stiffffffffff drink on cinco de mayo, or any other day/reason to get shwastey.

My friends and I have dubbed their margaritas as a "murderita" because they are probably the strongest and unexpecting margarita I've ever had. Probably around 6 seconds of a tequila pour, half a lime, and a dash of margarita mix. You can get it with or without salt, and its served cold over ice. Drink responsibly. I warned you.

This place however can get very packed on the weekends, has only 2 bathrooms, and is semi strict with the bouncer at the door (with capacity, but understandly so). I rather come here on a weekday night rather than the weekend to avoid the shoving and pushing around inside, not to mention the loud music. But overall, FUN.
author: Alex R.

description:
Really sad to give a poor review but God damn that bartender with the black curly hair is a righteous b*tch!!!  I went to the bar and ordered 2 margaritas and a g&t, as the bartender was making the margaritas I asked to have both of them with salt. She then asked me where I worked, I told her the vicinity, believing it to be bartender banter for her to precede with "do I come to your work and tell you how to do your job?!", it's a Margarita honey ,salt is an option!! One you did not ask so yeah slight over reaction!

The group next to me tell me she has been like this to everyone... well the only way this prima donna is going to understand her rudeness hurts business is to protest with our cash, she got a resounding $0 tip. Time to rally the troops and get the hell out of there!! 

As a bartender I'd rather you don't give the rest of us a bad name! Oh and the "A$$hole" comment when you collected your cash seems like I got my point across. Stop ruining a good establishment with your stinking attitude.
author: Hannah D.

description:
Ummm...recipe for success = 1.5 margaritas + 1 beer = hangover.

That's what happens when their margarita is pretty much a pint of tequila for $8.  I was told before coming here that you get drunk just watching the bartender make the margarita. They weren't kidding.  The pint glass is literally filled 5/7 of the way to the top with tequila, 1/7 of triple sec, and 1/7 of empty space so you don't walk around spilling everywhere.  

Oh and I love the sun faded pinatas hanging from the ceiling.
author: Christopher T.

description:
Yesterday night at the Latin American Club in the Mission I was ridiculed for not tipping for a drink, told to stay home if I could not tip, and yelled at "This is America" as if I should go back to whatever foreign land I am from. I was really disturbed by the lack of respect that also made me think of the Latino community that has to deal with disrespect for not meeting the high socioeconomic status quo that SF is bounty with. I could feel the tension in the streets of the mission as I walked away with someone yelling "THIS IS AMERICA" from a bar that never plays any spanish music but is called The Latin American Club. A place where this Caucasian male bartender persistently made it certain I would learn my lesson, and probably never go back there again. As much as he probably wanted to break me, belittle me, and probably lose faith I know this only makes me want to work harder to resist cultural displacement.

You will not find a trace of Latin American culture here except that of some old pinatas that are probably just there so the bar can pass as Latin American friendly.
author: Sofia E.

description:
Yet another dark, dank dive in the midst of the Mission.

I dig the piñatas hanging from the ceiling. A few of them are slightly creepy in the red lighting, but maybe that's why I like them. 

My friends ordered drinks while I took a bathroom break. They opted for the $9 Margarita (which does indeed get the job done, based on the fact they were all staggering as they headed out the door).

I opted for the $8 Moscow Mule special, which consisted of mostly ice, then vodka with a splash of ginger beer and lime. My glass was considerably smaller than the ones my friends had, and it tasted like a watered down vodka. 

Bartender Dude, you fail. 

I had an okay buzz going, but I wasn't nearly drunk enough to listen to my group's awful gossiping or the terrible tunes the DJ was playing at Beauty Bar, our next stop. 

I suppose next time I'll suck it up and order that damn Margarita.
author: Brandi W.

description: Douglas Adams described the sensation of drinking a Pangalactic Gargle Blaster, as "like having your brains smashed out by a slice of lemon, wrapped 'round a large gold brick.". LAC's margaritas inspire a similar sensation, but without the lemon... Or gold brick. It's a nice enough place with a fairly legit bar, but why anyone would want to go there and order something other than the margarita is beyond me. Then again, I once signed a pact to never go here when already drunk, because that margarita (which, let's be honest, is really just a giant glass of tequila that someone showed a lime to) really, really hurts.
author: Duncan C.

description:
Despite its lame name, the Latin American Club is a really cool place. It's one of my favorite places in the Mission, even with its curmudgeonly bartenders and tendency to get super loud and crowded fast. Admittedly, the beer and wine selection also leaves more to be desired, but here's the secret of this place: 

Don't get anything else except the margarita.

If you want a cheap, fun night out in San Francisco, this is the first place to come. They are generous -- and I mean, GENEROUS -- with the tequila. The margarita itself tastes like death, but hey, if I can drink one eight dollar drink and be set for the rest of the night, I'm sold. 

Also, shout outs to the awesome decor. Pinatas and giant hamsters? Yesss.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Woke up yesterday morning with
a terrific urge to roll over in bed
and die. Fought against it for a minute.

Then looked out the window at the sun.
And groaned aloud. Lost myself entirely
in the keep of a hellacious hangover.

Would I live that night ever again?
Drink the same unforgivable margarita? 
No, given half a chance. Definitely not.
author: Chris L.

description:
Pros: 
Strong margaritas that are not too expensive
Limited outdoor seating

Cons:
Bartender seemed really annoyed when I asked for Patron (sorry...?)
Cash only
author: Priscilla M.

description:
A dim and whimsical dive bar with tons of character. If you can snag the booth by the window, it's a perfect night in the Mission for people watching and stiff drinks.

FYI, cash only, and no ATM.
author: Annie L.

description:
Pinatas on the ceiling? CHECK.
$8 huge, strong, delicious margaritas? CHECK.
$4 strong well drinks? CHECK.
Able to bring in a delicious burrito? CHECK.

Only problem...everyone and their mom knows about this place. Get here early for any hope of seating. And bring cash.
author: Talia G.

description:
Cool bar with piñatas on the ceiling, lots of seating, good drinks...and cheap!  The Margaritas here are top-notch (i.e., "strong and tasty"). but I always stick with beer, wine or gin & juice.  

The bathroom situation always kind of confuses me because I can't tell which is which.  I *think* the one on the right is the women's restroom, but when I went in the seat was up, so I don't know if I was confused or if the guy who went in there before me was confused....
author: Kimberly B.

description: The word I'm going to choose for the margaritas here is 'weapons grade.' That is all.
author: Bryce A.

description:
The insulting bartender brought this bar down to 1 star. I used to come here before I would go out to El Rio on the weekends for their margaritas. 
Haven't been here in a few months and after my experience a few Saturday nights ago, I won't be going back.
I have worked retail and food service jobs a majority of my adult life, so I understand what it's like to deal with rude, demanding customers and how to be cool and handle myself with tact in stressful situations. Never once did I insult someone or give them attitude when they asked for their money back or told me they didn't like the end product. 
My 2 friends and I came in here for margaritas, since they're in pint glasses. Well apparently the price has gone up from $8 to $10 and now $12 for their regular margaritas. Unaware of the new $12 price, we decided to step it up a little and order 2 margaritas with Cazadores (not top shelf but not well tequila). 
When the bartender handed my friend the drinks and told her it was $40 for 3 drinks, she was understandably surprised. When she asked for the breakdown the bartender rudely said "you ordered margaritas with Cazadores", which are apparently $16 each and $8 for a regular size Bulleit Bourbon and Coke.
As we were getting the cash together, since we were all surprised, the bartender again gave us attitude and said she'd be back when we were ready. I'm usually a generous tipper but this time I refused to tip at all (she didn't need to make us feel like we were idiots or children). 
So we decide to get past the rude attitude of the bartender and enjoy our drinks, unfortunately our $16 margaritas tasted like Margarita Mixer and very little tequila.
