Great conversation, their leathers totally turned me on. the girl I was with was cool with it.

OH! And, everyone in the place is talking to someone, hanging out. No wallflowers aloud. Just a lot of good, genuine people who understand the meaning of the Latin American Club:

Awesomesauce.
author: mario b.

description: Tasty margi's with a serious kick...two will do you solid enough to nearly leave your laptop there.
author: David H.

description:
If you ever run a relatively cozy bar, please DO NOT leave tables throughout the middle of the establishmentt on a very crowded Saturday night. This will result in very slim, very clogged pathways to walk through. You will wind up squeezing on one size against someone sitting at a table, thus ruining their experience, & squeezing against everyone else (who are already squeezed against the bar) on the other side, thus ruining their experience as well.

I've been there before & it was okay, but last Saturday I found all this bumping & squeezing to be completely intolerable. I had been wine tasting all day & I was really tired (still a little drunk, too), but I had to be out because it was a very good friend's birthday. I have a feeling it would've been an amazing time were it not for the table issue & a few folks who were a little too shovey (patience, people! we're ALL trying to move!). I actually got sortof irate at this one guy who shoved through a crowd of people (including myself & my ladyfriend) to get to some waiting friends at the other end of the bar. No 'excuse me'...dude just looked right past us & plowed through. Were I a more unreasonable man, that would've been grounds for a roundhouse kick to the face.

Basically, whole thing could've been solved if they would've just stacked the damn tables against the wall & made everyone stand like any other bar would. It's all well & good to leave tables out if you don't want a lot of customers, but if you're going to pack 'em, stack 'em.

Also, THERE ARE NO LATINS HERE, so WTF is up w/the name? I only saw Americans. And hipsters.

Yes, I said WTF. DEAL WITH IT.
author: Pete J.

description: A go-to bar in the Mission. Cheaper drinks and good measures. Get's a bit shovey later on but maybe I'm just getting old. I've usually been on Friday nights recently and the girl behind the bar is super efficient and remembers your drink orders round to round. She seems to run the whole bar herself and I still don't wait long to be served even when it starts to get busy. Margaritas are large+strong as per all the other reviews.
author: Alex B.

description:
I can't believe that I've lived so close to this bar for so long and had never been there until a few days ago...  but I made up for it by going two nights in a row!

When you're not in the mood to walk down to 16th, go to the Lone Palm for the 800th time, or deal with the Marina spillover at Medjool/Laszlo, this is a very good alternative.  The crowd was chill, unpretentious, and the drinks were ridiculously strong.

The owners should really get an easier to see sign, though.
author: Alissa K.

description:
Go here.

Like everyone else says their margaritas are absolutely killer.  And I know you are probably thinking to yourself, "Sure sure girly, I can handle my Tequila.  I'm sure these Margaritas aren't anything I can tame."  Well douche bag your wrong.

I dare to try and finish 4, nay, 3 of LAC's Margaritas.  You might thank me.  

Actually, no, you won't thank me.
author: Chelsea C.

description: Fun place.. good stuff on tap! We discovered this place because we had to wait like 2 hours to eat at Barreta. we loved it! awesome place to hang out, cant wait to get back to SF to have some drinks here!
author: Bianka V.

description: This is an A-OK spot if you just want to sit and chat while you sip a cocktail. The margaritas are strong, but for $4 you can get a mini, which is a nice alternative. The bartenders are nice and it is good for groups :) It's not like a regular bar, and it is not a very social place (most people come with groups of friends). But it is good for socializing amongst those you come with.
author: Shira O.

description:
This is the first bar I went to in San Francisco and still my favorite to this day. Good music, an unpretentious crowd, and great bartenders. Get them to make you a Manhattan or margarita, and you will find you're sort of walking/stumbling on a diagonal line the whole way home. Gets really loud on the weekends, so this is not a good place to talk about your feelings, but instead a place to numb them entirely with the aforementioned cocktails. 

Great place to take your cool out-of-town friends. Even better place to hide from your not-as-cool in-town friends.
author: Jill C.

description: You only need 1 margarita, peoples!!! JUST ONE!!! x_x
author: Keika L.

description:
Years ago, before all the Comming And Bombing, when Whitey did rightfully fear The Mission, The Latin-American Club was named to reflect it's clientele. You had to have a mustache for entry, a cowboy hat for further acceptance and a good command of conversational Spanish to get a drink. Whitey didn't dare...

Back then, my homeboy Scott LaRock rented a room across the street that overlooked the joint, and any weeknight offered the possibility of watching a few vaqueros waving knives and cursing at each other. All from a safe distance. Weekends were even better!

All said, I kinda miss the old Latin. Even though I never actually went there. Even though the drinks are always stiff. Even though Tara and Freya, both wonderful bartenders, work there and this never would have been possible during its Un-ironic Straw Cowboy Hat period.  

The beers here have never suited me. Too California. Too small for its pool table, the place gets packed easily, at which point Whitey spills out to the sidewalk. Yet even when backed by his entire crew, there's exactly no danger of Whitey getting into an actual Jets And The Sharks, Fenix City knife-fight here anymore. 

That, I believe, is what The City has lost.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Be careful, the lighting in here makes everyone look better.

One of their margaritas is possibly all you'll need, more than this you may take the "Sin" sign above the exit  too literally and wake up somewhere you don't want to.
author: Debu M.

description: Oh, Lat Am, how I love thee.  I failed to mention that these dirt cheap drinks are incredibly strong.  It was probably the best four bucks I spent this past weekend.  If you're over the prepartying at home (endless shots of smirnoff just isn't the same post-college) then you should definitely mosey on over to Lat Am and partake in the cheap drinks, darky cozy atmosphere and cool folks.
author: Karen N.

description: This is where I bring people to have serious conversations of which they will have no memory...strong ass drinks and usually a dog running around. My criteria is met
author: Melissa H.

description:
Oh the times I've had at this club.  Back when I was underage this was one of the only clubs me and my adolescent friends could get into.  We would sit in the window booth all night, pretending we were as cool as the red man, you know the guy who would wake up every morning and decide it was a good idea to paint his entire body red.  Hmmmmm...  
But Seriously, I can't remember any specifics of the club, all I know is that this club made me feel like I was special!
author: Stacey K.

description:
Epiphany number two. There's a simple truth to the Mission for a boy, we're a tyranny of cads. To regress momentarily whilst I give light to this theory, in this world there exists two types of boy - the dad, that of paternal behavior and burgeoning resources. His shirt beckons a broad belt, and never one to shy away from an elaborate crotch adjustment - as though to imply the weight of adulthood is his to know alone. Then we have the cads, we lack staying power, ambition and smarts - but we gots the razzle dazzle. Evolution stymies serendipity - girl goes for her dad.
 
There's an end to be reached, but not yet.

Pre-conclusive-copulation this girl wanders into the Latin American Club. She permeates the need for a zipless fuck, bitingly put as "a sexual consummation, presumably with a cad, so quick, so spontaneous, and so "in the moment" that unzipping isn't even called for." And we reach our purpose. The platonic ideal. 

"A perfect encounter in which zippers fell away like rose petals, underwear blew off in one breath like dandelion fluff."

This is modern love.
author: Marc M.

description: Been here a couple of times and leaving without being a little tipsy has never happened. Great deals on the brews they have on tap. Cool place to chill, although it can get a bit loud. But you wouldn't be too bothered by the noise after a couple of drinks. You just end up talking louder and figuring out who really listens to what you have to say.
author: Alvin T.

description: Everyone should add the LatAm club to their happy hour rotation. But, please, institute a two Margarita maximum on your fellow revelers. I cannot be held accountable for what happens on your third Marg.  Brown outs will be the least of your problems.  You can bring in food from nearby. Arrive early if you want a table.
author: Christian Z.

description:
Stumbled upon this bar last Wednesday night. Who knew that this place would be packed?

We walked in and ordered up our drinks- 2 drinks, 1 cran & grey goose and the other with jack daniels and coke. 

Each drink had very little mixer...so, my cran & vodka- almost clear, maybe a super light shade of pink, almost all vodka-thank god for the lime! 

After our drink, I was done.  Buzzed! So I called it a night .

BTW-  I would give extra stars for the pinatas hanging above.  I'm latina, so a pinata always screams a good time:)
author: Valarie A.

description:
One manhattan, down the hatch!
Two manhattan, down the hatch!

Bathroom break. Nice blurrry people in line.

Another manhattan? Did I make it a batch?

Smear of city lights out of the cab window. 
Wake up with a trail of clothes from the front door to the bed.

...

Yup, I like this place.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Call them "forget me now" margaritas. They're strong, delicious, and after several rounds you won't remember a thing.
author: Alex H.

description:
After Nick, I went to 22nd St.

On the curb (I took a drink outside).

Fresh air, smelled like cigarettes, felt good. 

I didn't stay long at Latin. Thanks to a good friend-- I'm lucky. She took me to Rye.
author: Jenny T.

description:
This place is great, they have the most wastedness in a single pint glass possible for $7.

Either get the bloody mary or the margarita, but you already know this.

Also, I'd like to tell a hilarious story about comin here once.

We were there with a group of friends, a few of us are locals to SF.  Well, I was off getting some money from the ATM as they do not take cash here. So when we return, there was some kinda issue with some anti-gentrification white guy who was angry for the number of chairs we were using, one of which was mine, being held while I return from the ATM.

Well, this anti-gentrification-of-the-mission white guy proceeded to call us new in town (APPALINGLY FALSE) so I asked him which high school he went to, which he declined to answer.

AND THEN.. the irony of the situation comes full front... which, for some reason, he proceeded to call me, AT THE LATIN AMERICAN CLUB, which I must emphasize, A "WETBACK".

Are you KIDDING ME?  So I insisted that he was totally mad and that he lacked the ability to understand the irony in which he indulged, as well as the total racism, and obvious self-loating (being an anti-gentrificatio white person) he was clearly and obviously expressing.  At which time, I reminded him, with the help of my chair, inverted and fully extended in the air, if you really want the mission to not be gentrified, all whites should leave, including yourself.

This bar should aptly be renamed, POOR WHITE NON-LATIN AMERICAN CLUB.

I recommend it

 A++++
author: christopher a.

description: Not a big fan of this place. super crowded... cash only.. mehh...
author: Cindy L.

description:
I met some friends here for beer after work. It seemed like a really cool place, even though as a Latin American myself, this bar had nothing to do with my people or culture. As my friends and I, all law students, discussed police brutality against communities of color, one of us noticed that there was a NOOSE hanging on the wall. 

We asked the bartender why they had a noose hanging on the wall, and she said that it was because it was quirky. I almost threw up. I know I shouldn't be, but I'm amazed that even today, in a place that is so "progressive" as San Francisco, a bar would think that a noose, a symbol of violent repression against African Americans, Native Americans, immigrants, and countless other peoples, that this symbol would be "quirky"?!!! We left, and I am NEVER going back.
author: Cecilia C.

description:
I'm not telling you what my number one all time favorite secret thing about this place is bc I don't want it to get gone. 

I will say: 

Ditto all applauding or fearing the largess of the bartenders when making their margaritas. Um, yeah, they're strong ('tenders and margaritas).

What is it also I love? The light is great at the Latin when it opens in the evening. 

Great dreamy fun too, watching the tables and chairs shift throughout the course of the evening like one of those puzzles -- you know, the nine little squares you shift around somehow, not Rubik's Cube.... 

O you NEVER have to wait in line for the bathroom here! It is shocking to me! And it's just one stall for girls! These girls can hold their drink.  I mean eeeeveryhwere else, a line. Not The Latin.

What's everyone all up about about the name? It's the name of the place. And it sounds nice. 

And, maybe this belongs on some other establishment's review board, but what is everyone so UP about the hipsters??? Every place I go to review in the Mission is riddled with complaints of "their" presence.  Isn't there possibly, just maybe, maybe, o c'mon, maaaybe, something else better stronger more evil to rage against in our big machine? 3 words for thought?: George W. Bush.


?
author: Julia W.

description:
Please note, this is actually a 10 star review.

*How* did I not know about the most lethal cocktails in this entire city?  Oh whaaaat...is that a margarita or a pint glass full of tequila with a splash of lime that somehow tastes like a margarita?  I'll drink one and find out.  I love this place, I love their pinata collection, I love the cuckoo clocks on the wall, I esp. love the nurse above the door and I really, really love their stiff dranks.  Yea, I called 'em dranks.
author: Emily T.

description:
Pinatas hang from the ceiling.  A giant chihuahua that is 7 feet tall stares at you from the wall.  A sign telling you that any drug use will not be tolerated.  
  
Strong drinks, a cold bartender with an icy stare, and a bar tab that came to what!  You've got to be kidding me.  That's it?  You mean I've been overpaying for Ketel and crans everywhere else in the city.  C'mon...you're pulling my leg.   Inexpensive drinks all around.  

Ended up leaving this place pretty close to DOMA.  In case you didn't know, "drunk off my ass."  A good feeling.

You can bet your box of twinkies that I'll be back.
author: Dennis M.

description: now we know where all the cute girls out , I heard they make good margaritas they looked  awesome , but there is no substitute for Beer , good pre game spot :) check it out
author: NAEL K.

description: One of our favorite bars. Strong, cheap drinks, interesting artwork, and ability to score a table if you keep and eye out, before too long.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Something about that melancholy look on the chihuahua in the large painting just speaks to me....  Plenty of other eclectic things in here too, like doors hanging from the ceiling, mummies, and pinatas.

Great place to hang out when you want something more than a dive bar, but also want something quieter than Lazslo and The Make-Out-Room. Drinks are well-priced, decent selection on tap, and usually you can snag one of the rickety plastic chairs that look like they were around since the Eisenhower-era.

Also gotta love the pool table that's a bit too close to the wall/bar.  I always end up getting roped into a game of pool and have to awkwardly tell people to leave their bar stools or else get a cue stick somewhere painful...last time I was there I noticed that someone had fashioned a sawn-off cue stick which is perfect for those awkward shots.
author: Neej M.

description:
I walked in around 10:30 on a Thursday and it was busy, slowed a bit around 11:00 and picked up again around midnight. I went in to meet some people I had never met before and quickly felt right at home. I don't live in the Mission, but I still felt at home. Some young hipsters, some geeks, some normal folks and of course some wack-jobs ... 

Service was good,  the bar was steady but not busy, atmosphere is relaxed and interesting with ecclectic decor to go with the people. 

I think this is one of many interesting neighborhood bars in an interesting part of the city. Might be hard to get a drink when its really busy. A good place to be a regular I bet. I wish it was in my neighborhood.

Easy 3 blocks for BART folks.
author: JX C.

description:
Cheap, shitty margaritas. If getting wasted with a HUGE crowd on a weekend night is your thing, then this place is for you. If you like rude bartenders that take forever, a nasty bathroom, and a room full of douchbags then come get your drink on.

I prefer places that even pretend to have some class- especially with women who aren't fall down drunk. But I hear the owner takes advantage of that.
Go to Heart and enjoy some decent wine and a decent crowd. It's only around the corner.
author: David B.

description:
This is where to go on Saturdays after you're done looking cool at Boogaloo's. Beer selection is standard, decor is visually interesting, and there's cool art on the walls. The pool tables are accessible on weeknights, but quickly turn into convenient seating on the weekends.

The bartenders are cool. But I wouldn't plan on being best buddies with them any time soon.

I basically like this place because it tends to be full of my friends, and is a block from my house.
author: Blake E.

description:
I don't know why it's called Latin American Club.  There were a lot of non-Latino hipster geeks, few Latin Americans. 

Either way, this place is cool.  

The Margaritas "rock" if you are into getting hammered after two drinks.  They are strong, not tasty.  

Good place to go with friends.
author: Laura G.

description:
I just changed my rating from 2 to 4 stars.  I think it actually was the fact that I was going through major nicotine withdrawals that I was so tough on the Latin American club last time.  Then, waiting for a drink for 10 minutes felt like 2 hours.  I went again on Friday night, didn't have to wait more than 2 minutes for a drink, had a great time, met a lot of nice people, and now have a generally favorable disposition towards the place.   Below is my old review that has more description.....

-----------------------------

I think I am just bitter because I quit smoking 8 days ago, but  nobody should ever have to wait 15 minutes for a drink at a bar that is not crowded.   The bartender didn't understand the concept of helping people at both ends of the bar, and I nearly lost my shit.  I am usually very understanding about the stresses of bartending/waitressing, but this was waaay excessive.  For the first time in my life, I did not tip the bartender.  

On a lighter note, the bar itself is pretty rad. Lots of  pinatas hanging from the ceiling,  a life-sized nurse doll holding a big dildo above the doorway, and a giant rat attacking the bar area, all give this place a unique flavor all its own.  I'm also down with the seventies'ish tables and chairs.  The crowd is hip, but not I want to puke in my mouth hip.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
empty pinata's hang over the heads of drunk patrons. being it monday, the place was packed and alive. great for groups to catch up and mustard. if i can remember correctly, it was very dark and had red lights throughout the bar.

service at the bar not so good. not so cute. not so fast. not so friendly. 
i think i had to wait at least 5 mins every time i went up to the bar. why? he wasn't busy, just not able to be found. maybe cause he played the bartender, bar back, the bouncer, and the busser. hire someone else  already. 

i'm not going to give this place a bad review because i always seem to have a good time here. the atmosphere is quite chill and the location is convenient. a really good spot to meet up and go somewhere else if you don't like it. all of the bars in mission have the same type of crowd and charm, so you're not going to get much better. plenty of eye candy and the other patrons are always friendly.
author: Noy K.

description: One word:  margarita.  Well, it's actually more like a pint of tequila with a splash of sweet and sour.  Just how I like it.  Definitely divey.  But if I can get a good buzz off of one $8 margarita?  Then it's totally worth it.  And the margaritas taste great.  Good location.  Bartenders are easy going, no-frills kind of people.  Seating is limited, like most bars.  If you are a lover of the margarita, then this is a must try.
author: Jenna C.

description:
Great dive....have been going here irregularly for almost 20 years now (yeah, y'all...I'm the white-haired guy)....

also, oddly, a place where hot chicks will actually approach YOU...hmmm....or maybe I've just hit the nights right....

strong drinks have been already noted....and, quite nice, the bartenders will offer you up a free one when they spill one into your lap...

gentlemen, all the way....

kudos to the SIN sign and the naughty nurse, too....60's linoleum and aluminum tables.....and trips to the restroom feel like spilunking....

arty crowd, no investment bankers to be seen.....

what more could you ask for in a hole-in-the-wall...?
author: El K.

description:
Strong pours on the magaritas; i was pretty buzzed after 1. 
The place has a hipster vibe...but i'm not thrilled with the urine smell in the club; that's pretty damn gross
author: Jocelyn L.

description: I had a drink once with a dear old friend here. Then he passed away and we convened here again in his honor. Turns out he'd taken everyone he knew/loved to the Latin American Club at one time or another. If my fallen homie liked this place that much it's OK in my book.
author: Wesh W.

description:
This place is my new fav in the hood! The drinks are super duper strong.. the crowd is eclectic.. and the bartenders are great..

Total dive! but awesome!
author: Monica S.

description:
WTF? As others have mentioned, it's not a club.  And it's a total misnomer because, despite the title and my friend and his girlfriend, I didn't see any other Latinos in the bar.  Instead, it should be renamed "Gringo Bar." I asked a patron, and the person said Latinos in San Fransciso don't go out at night. Are you serious? In the mission?

Someone also please explain to me why I can't buy Mexican beer at a place with the terms "Latin American" in the name. Instead, they serve pear cider and anchor steam. Yo, hit me up with the traditional Latin American beverage of pear cider. That don't sound right!

3 stars for the divey atmosphere, but I deduct 2 for the false name.
author: Triet N.

description: Nice chill and relaxed place to hang with buddies over candle light. Great great place. Margarita was made for potency rather than quality. It was great though. It hit the spot. Perfect place to preload before hitting up clubs with overpriced bars.
author: Juan Miguel S.

description:
This is one of my favorite bars in the city, and I have many happy memories here. The margaritas are arguably the best and deadliest in SF, besides Tommy's, Tia Margarita's, and Tres Agaves. If you can handle more than 3 of these pint-sized beauties in a row, I will kneel at your feet. (And I bet you'll be kneeling over the toilet later that night.) 

This is definitely the place to visit around twilight, if you can, just because nothing beats drinking a margie when the sun is going down. By 10pm it gets ridiculously packed, and you'll know it's time to move on to Mexican food at Alta Dena.
author: Jane R.

description:
Demoted. They took out the pool table.

-------------------------
You know you're in the big leagues when pear cider is featured on the chalk board menu. 

Wait - I think it's the same board from when I was in undergrad. Timeless for sure. It's the company you bring to the bar rather than the place itself that make it memorable though. More a shooting the sh*t kind of drinking place.
author: Tanya P.

description: Paid $12 for a stout and a soda, seems kind of overpriced. Noisy, pushy people, surly bartender. Maybe it was a bad night, but I definitely won't return.
author: Ali K.

description:
Let the lilly-livered be forewarned "Lead-Hands" lives here! There's no room for humor with him, only business. He could be considered more of an undertaker than a bartender...but who's complaining? Quietly I think his cousin is the bandana-neck chef at Tu Lan. After your fifth stiffy don't be scared by his pinata minions. Keep it cool and remember they really are just inanimate objects.

Arrre!
author: NaN K.

description:
I have another insider secret about this place (and the Make Out Room). If you haven't eaten dinner, are a lightweight, DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT order the margarita. My sources tell me this is four drinks for the price of one. Got it? :) Now, that is what I call a HAPPY hour. You've been warned...

***

Again people, why go to dive bars if you are lookin' for something like Circa? Just don't do it! The one review below, about the surly dude, is probably the owner who also bartends at the latin - and  word the the wise, don't request vodka redbulls, they don't have it, won't serve it and find it offending to be asked for it. 

My review: I love the dodgy places, the place is a dope watering hole, you can stand outside, they have prosecco and I heart Pinatas. Oh, one more thing shouties to Jill & Dan - you R to the OCK.
author: Ingrid K.

description:
Pinatas = hangover symptoms
Directly proportional, mathematical.
Proved, at least three experiments.
I don't remember clearly the first two.
author: Dario B.

description: This place is nice.  If you can get somewhere to sit it's even better.  I prefer it on the weekdays because the weekends get CRAZY crowded.  Great place to go when bar hopping in the mission.  Make sure you try the margaritas, that's what they're known for.
author: Steve R.

description: I saw the chihuahua painting and I knew that I would like this place.  Cool spot on a weekday night to chill and grab a strong @ss margarita.  I had one and was tipsy.  I would've had another but I'm trying to be more responsible...yeah, right!
author: michelle s.

description:
I have had many a wonderful experience here, but perhaps the most humorous was one night when I was with a couple of pals and we met some Canadians (or at least I think that's what they were) whom got wonderfully drunk.

After many a libation, one Canuck proceeded to throw up all over her open-toed sandals, and then slide around in the sidewalk, toes and all in the vomit. Her boyfriend, or at least that's what I took him to be, was sitting at the table outside while this was occurring and commenced vomiting as well, although unfortunately he did not have any open toed footwear.  A "barforma" akin to that of "Stand by Me" fame right in the Mission.  Good times. 

Not to mention this place has some of the best bartenders in the city with some of the stiffest drinks. The only reason it gets four stars as opposed to five is the hipster contingent.  I guess these skinny, white-belt, irony-laden doucebags are better then the Chads and Jens from the Marina.
author: sean k.

description:
Lethal Margaritas served in full beer glasses for $6.

I could easily end the review with that, but what else I remember is an impressive pinata collection suspended from the bars ceiling, including power rangers and elephants. Go go power rangers! 

Super crowded and loud, with filthy bathrooms, it's just the place if you are in for a ridiculous night in the mission.
author: Kelly C.

description: Fun little place with great, cheap drinks.  Great vibe, great hang out...
author: Wendy L.

description: Holy mother fucking Margaritas! Are these blended with Everclear? Latin American Club blends up a potent Margarita. Three or four of these and you are set for the night. Face down in a gutter perhaps. Bar interior and vibe is quite similar to all the other along the Valencia corridor. Place warrants a visit to experience some fine drinks. The bartenders are friendly and quick to serve up the cocktails. One was even kind enough to politely warn us that two might be enough. Did not abide by the warning. Can I order a double next time?
author: Ryan G.

description: Love this place! Always order yourself a Margarita, it will be the best $8 you have ever spent in your life. You will only be able to have 2 maximum of these cause they are STRONG! But don't fear, they are tasty and worth it. I love coming here at night but also on a lazy Sunday Funday :)
author: Tara W.

description: Cheap drink, strong pours.  And I got to stare at a girl with 80's style basketball socks.  It was our compromise place since Medjool (around the corner with a roof-bar) was absurd.  Turned out well.
author: Nelson A.

description:
Some nice red wine and good conversation catching up with an old friend/former roommate. This place couldn't have been a better setting.

The bar was perfect for conversation and the music was just loud enough for me to decipher the band playing (The Meters, that in it of itself gives them a star) but not so loud that I had to shout my entire conversation. (Note: This was a Thursday night, right after work so it may get rowdier later in the night and/or on the weekends.)

Small, intimate, cozy and the bathroom is usable. Go here if you want to catch up with old friends and rather not do it in your living room. Refreshing. 

It's the kind of bar that doesn't try to stuff its personality down your throat. It is what it is, and that is a bar for people to convene, drink, and have a simple good time. Nothing more, nothing less. And that's fine with me.

Note: There's no big sign on the door. Look for the neon horseshoe if you're trying to find this place at night.
author: Viv C.

description: After two visits, his is probably the only bar in the Mission I would enthusiastically return to. I'm not about to make regular appearances but for having a drink or two with friends, this place treats me right. I like the pinatas, the outdoor seating, the two unisex bathrooms, the mismatched chairs, and the strength of their cocktails. The music is a touch too loud for my tastes, but compared to most places it's fairly reasonable.
author: charlotte c.

description:
love this place. it is cute. great spot to hang out w/ friends -please dont come here for the wine- seriously, it tastes like shit and you;d have  a better time w/ beer..

weekends get crazy busy- i have also been here on a weekday which was so much better. I would come here again...on a weekday!

Bartender (i had the same one twice that i have been here) has major attitude. I thought it was funny. 

i dunno why it is called Latin American Club.. there is nothing Latin American here ,except the pinatas hanging from the ceiling... can someone clarify that for me pls? ..and my 2nd question wd be...Is there candy in those pinatas?
=)
author: C A.

description:
My friends seem to love this place.  I was kind of "meh" about it myself.  I went there with some coworkers after work one day.  I didn't see anything all that impressive about it.  It as a pool table which is nice, and a table up on a stage.  Other than that, I wasn't too impressed.

::shrug::
author: Shane L.

description: Early evening on a weeknight = possibility of getting a window table, mellow people watching, gentle viognier drinking, mostly local crowd. Friday and Saturdays are a bit hellish. The mixed drinks are very strong, as many people have confirmed.
author: Hannah S.

description: Great collection of pinatas, cheap drinks, and an eclectic crowd. What more could you ask for on a Saturday night? Well, I guess I would ask for a little more room to move around, but aside from that I'm satisfied.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I've seen the neon glowing horseshoe sign a countless number of times, but haven't ever actually wondered what it was a sign for. turns out it's Club Latin American. what a random name. what the hell would be inside a place named club latin american? mariachi music? no. a lot of latin americans? no. pinatas? Yes!! lots of them, hanginging all over the ceiling. other than the pinatas though, there's really not too much about the bar that reflects its name. instead, it's a typical mission bar. not exactly a dive, but definitely has a chill dive type atmosphere and strong drinks.

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com )
author: vlad k.

description: I don't know what's up with the drink menu here. They've got this house cocktail that's basically a pint of tequila with just the slightest essence of lime wafted over it. It's a fantastic, deliciously dangerous drink (especially at $8), but for some unfathomable reason the good people at Latin American Club decided to call it a margarita. Maybe they didn't know someone was already using that name for a rather mild-mannered girly drink that coincidentally also has tequila in it? I can only imagine how many people have mistakenly ordered this "margarita" only to be first perplexed, then ecstatic, then utterly destroyed by their drink. If the bar renamed it to something like "Agua Fresca del Diablo", "El Diablo's tears", "El Diablo is laughing at your poor decision making" or something along those lines they'd really clear up a lot of confusion and keep certain people from making a fool out of themselves after having waaaaay too many "margaritas". Anyways, what do I know? I'm not a naming expert, I'm just a man with a hangover.
author: Mark A.

description:
Cheap, STRONG drinks. Filthy bathrooms. Amazing, enormous paintings of chihuahuas and assorted other canines. Hipsters. If that doesn't sound like a recipe for a fun-filled night, I don't know what does. 

Warning: I have yet to make it home at a reasonable time or reasonably sober when I start out at this place.
author: Michelle M.

description:
This is a really great bar. The drinks are STRONG. The crowd is a good mix and it has a nice layout that is conducive to meeting people.

Beware, the name is no indication of what the feel of this place is like. There really is nothing latin american or clubby about it. 

Also beware of doing shots here, they're HUGE.
author: Jen M.

description:
I went there for the first time on Sat night.  Probably the wrong night, since it was so crowded and the drinks were tiny and they didn't have much of a menu.  Also, I felt like I was getting yelled at by the staff th whole time I was there.

 But aside from that, once we got a table and had a corner to ourselves. It was better.  We got a chance to relax and not get our drinks spilled all over ourselves and ended up having a great time.  We met some interesting people just as we were getting kicked out.

I will try it on a Tues or Wed and see if it is any better.
author: A K.

description:
This non-club is a pretty chill bar for a Thursday night drink with your friends. We stumbled over here after a work-sponsored happy hour for some non-work related imbibing, and the atmosphere is nice. It wasn't too crowded, the lone bartender got our drinks quickly and there was a pool table for kicks.

I have to complain a bit about the pool table and the awkward spot it is in- if you have to make a shot from either of the long sides of the table you are either backed up against the wall or poking some poor unfortunate barfly in the eye.

So, come here for drinks, but leave the pool playing to the contortionists.
author: Jessica P.

description:
The atmosphere is cool. 
I don't know if I came on a bad night but the bartender was really snobby when my friend asked for a PBR. I know it's not the best kind of beer, but shit, it was his first time there. Other than that, the place is pretty cool. I totally love the decorations and the huge Chihuahua posters! So random!

Also, I ordered ONE margarita. Just one. It came in a pint class and by the end of my drink, it was a pretty pungent margarita. I was probably the most boisterous one in the crowd which is least to say, awesome.

I wouldn't really come back here all the time though.
author: Shereen R.

description: If Tommy's has the best margaritas in SF, then Latin American Club has the strongest. You get about four shots worth of tequila in a pint glass for $7. I upgraded to Herradura Silver for $11 and it was well worth it. This place gets pretty crazy on the weekends but it's definitely a go-to spot for cheap drunkenness during the week.
author: Aaron V.

description: I love Latin American!!1!  There is this bartender there who makes the bestest vodka gimlets.  Oh yeah.  The people are nice there.  And check out that dead dog pinata over the bar...I'm going to steal it someday.
author: Des Esseintes I.

description:
This is a bar with a very laid back atmosphere and a great place to grab a drink with friends. It wasn't all that crowded when my friends and I got there, but it picked up quickly. It is a pretty small place, so when it picked up we didn't have space to move. Luckily the turn over at tables happens pretty fast; therefore we were able to get the best table in the place which is up on the stage! 

They have some pretty cheaply priced beers. I didn't have any mixed drinks, so I can't comment on them. The service was fast and the bartenders were friendly. 

The decor is definitely interesting with an assortment of pinatas hanging from the ceiling and the man made of feathers in the upper corner of the bar. Definitely check this place out.
author: Carly W.

description: Come for the margarita and forget why you came! Yes, seriously.  For $8 you get more than half of a pint glass of tequila with a splash of sweet and sour!  Mhmmm.  One (each) had my sis and I having a verrrry happy birthday.  Nuff said.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: I went here with a group of friends late on a Saturday night not knowing anything about the place, and was pleasantly surprised.  The atmosphere was pretty chill, and our group was able to find enough space to hang out together inside.  The margaritas are delicious and enormous! They pour tequila almost all the way to the top of the glass before adding the other ingredients -- you definitely get your money's worth!  As others have mentioned, the decor is interesting with all the pinatas (including Power Rangers!).  I will definitely come back for another fun-filled Saturday night that inevitably ends eating burritos at a taqueria at 3 am and dreading waking up the next morning.
author: Lotta A.

description: This is the first bar that I went to after moving to SF.  10 years later it's still one of my favorite places to hang out.  I have many fond memories of sitting at the table near the window at some late hour with good friends and having a great time...It's a great place with a great bohemian vibe.
author: Peter Z.

description:
Latin American Club, your bartender is SO SURLY.

But he pours strong drinks, even if he gives me a dirty look when I order them.  (Come on, a gin fizz doesn't deserve that evil of a stare!!!)

You will have this place to yourself on weekend nights before like 9pm, and it will be great.  It's fairly wretched when it is crowded, though.
author: Megan D.

description:
I'm reluctant to write this review because I would like to keep this bar a local secret.  The female bartendar with the short curly hair makes the best (aka strongest) drinks.  They are famous for their margaritas.  I go for the cosmos.  Just make sure you don't have more than two on an empty stomach!

The decor is electic.  The clientle is just casual.  Great place to just hang out and chill.
author: Christine L.

description: Awesome place, nice atmosphere, cool people. I've never thought it would be possible to get really drunk from less than $20 in the middle of San Francisco. Those margaritas are evil!!!
author: Geri Wendy J.

description: The crowd seemed old (like, "I have a career and 2 kids" old) for a "hipster" dive bar, but what do I know. Drinks were strong and cheap. If you can snag a table by the windows it's a nice vantage point for watching in- and outdoor shenanigans. Overall I was generally nonplussed, nothing special.
author: Keighley M.

description: Great margaritas, but I drank way too many and lost my backpack! My school ID is attached to it and all my contact info is on my certifications! Please, if someone happens to remember taking a black bag home I would appreciate my books and certs; keep my netbook and camera and socks! Great staff helping me try and find this thing on top of good service.
author: Kay d.

description:
This is a cool little step-above-dive-bar dive bar.  The decor is a bit Dia De Los Muertos meets cluttered attic, but it pulls it off well.  The chihuahua paintings are top notch and the vibe of the joint is a bit bike messenger bar, but without the fixies lined up out front.

I enjoyed the shit out of a couple of fresh margaritas, I highly recommend them.  There is a ton of booze in them so you best upgrade from the well tequila.

It still seems to be a bit underground, but maybe I am just telling myself that because I just finally made my way over there.
author: Tony A.

description:
aka "The Stinky American Club", why is it so chic to not bathe?  You are not compromising your 'coolness' by being a clean person, so wash and slap on some deodorant.

otherwise fun fun fun.
author: erica u.

description:
One can say the same thing about Latin American Club as about just about any other bar or restaurant in the Mission district:  it's absolutely awesome during the week when it's chill and all the locals are hanging out there, but it f#%@ing blows on Friday nights and weekends when the porsche-and-hummer crowd take over.  

Addendum:  "BASTA de su gente ricos y sus condominios!"  This was the message on the banner hanging from an apartment across the street the last time I went to Latin American Club.  I found it ironic, since 90% of the target audience (rich people who buy condos) probably don't speak any Spanish (unless, of course, it involves buying cocktails or ordering someone to mow the lawn).
author: Matthew M.

description: This place has always been one of my favorites! After our jazzy stay at the Revolution Cafe, we headed over here for a night cap. It is the perfect place to show a guest a great time- the atmosphere is impeccable with several pinatas hanging from the ceiling and beautifully dressed peeps, plus strong drinks. I've always loved the international crowd this place draws. Over all, fantastic.
author: Amber K.

description: A great get together spot, they make their drinks strong and the decor has an interesting twist. I had one too many margaritas and a watermelon beer (which I highly recommend to try). I'll definitely go here again. It can get a bit crowded but that's what makes the place happening.
author: Wilfred C.

description: They have the STRONGEST margaritas! Amazingly GREAT deal. You only need one to be drunk and 2-3 to get wasted. I went with a gay couple and 2 ladies on a very hot night in SF. Hot nights never happen, so this place was packed because you can sit outside... packed with fine ass dudes ;) We sat outside and enjoyed the night. The doorman is hella hilarious too.
author: heather m.

description: Their margaritas are equivalent to 3 normal margaritas. You have been warned. This place is above average for a dive bar but it is a dive bar so keep your expectations realistic.  I would recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a laid back, friendly atmosphere and strong drinks.  The patrons are not very outgoing so don't expect to make friends. Like most places in the city you should go with friends if you want to talk to somebody.
author: P D.

description: Fun spot in the mission.  Came here after dinner at spork.  Wasn't too crowded at 8p but towards 11p, the place got packed.  They make good margarita here.  For $8 you get a pint of drink and it's strong!! It's like having 3 drinks in 1. How lovely!!  Really mixed crowd, which i enjoyed. I hate when bars just have hipster types/only young people. Saw some old timers here enjoyin beverages.   Worth a visit, just go during off hours, otherwise you will have to squeeze into the bar w/ 20 something folks and compete for some 'turf.
author: Ka C.

description:
This is my favorite bar in the Mission.  I love the weird decor (faded pinatas, cuckoo clocks, etc).  

Was there on Saturday afternoon and a motorized trolley with tourists stopped in front and everyone piled out onto the pavement.  Actors then proceeded to recreate some sort of obscure argument that happened many years ago.  The entire tour group went inside for a drink and left the actors out front throwing shoes at eachother in front of my husband and I.  It was very strange and only added to the oddity of the place.
author: melissa o.

description: Cool place, STIFF drinks.  The margaritas are pros-only.  A good space too.  I like.
author: Jonas C.

description: If the margaritas were any stiffer here they'd be in a drawer at the morgue. There's a thin line between a refreshing adult beverage and a pint glass of poison. I vaguely recall a pinata mocking me. Beware.
author: wendella a.

description:
reason #52 why i am single:

cute boy:  you've got really beautiful eyes.

laura b: you should see my ass!  but you never will because i'm not dating until i lose 20 pounds!  okay well...see you later!

cute boy backs away and toward door never taking eyes off of laura b because he is unsure of her next move however he is suspicious that it might involve a hand grenade or other such weapon.

i always get greyhounds here.  not sure why.  it just seems right.  love the poor table and all the fun stuff on the walls.  nice bartenders.  cute boys abound...don't worry, i'll scare 'em off right quick, though.  yelp, never fear!  you will never EVER lose laura b to a relationship!
author: Laura B.

description: I give this bar a solid four stars, though my liver would beg to differ. These drinks are strong (and not that expensive), which equals major WIN!!! Finding a place to chill here on a Saturday night can prove to be quite the challenge - if I had had a lovely bar stool or cozy table to be able to savor the awesomeness that was my Long Island iced tea, then this would be solid five-star territory, in my book. Regardless, I am a fan and much to my liver's chagrin, I plan to be back many a time...
author: Rachel G.

description: $5.50 will get you cocktail that will knock you on your ass served by a bartender with a bad attitude. Pick your poison...
author: phil h.

description: Don't go here, it's so lame and not fun. I really dislike the strong drinks, and I really hate running into old friends and having a good time with them. Head to Blondie's, now that's a fun bar!
author: Nish N.

description:
If you've been here, then you already know 

the Latin is a 5 star BAR.  and I mean BAR. If you're looking for something else, then go elsewhere.

I mean c'mon - you can't beat the alcohol selection - what a great variety of liquor, whiskeys, especially - and for the price - it's almost ridiculous. Drinks are generously poured - you've been warned.

You're on YELP, so do yourself a favor - look at the negative reviews of this place and then look at that person's good reviews - chances are, that if you/they are more comfortable at Medjool, or in the Marina - then the Latin is probably not what you're looking for.

Don't go to a Jazz Club looking for New Kids on the Block...
author: Randy S.

description:
if you come here with someone totally rad, and you don't mind being condescended to by a pretentious, know-it-all bartender, then this place is amazing.

luckily, both those things are true of me, so i had a great time. however, for those of you who may not appreciate none getting treated like an 11-year old at a brothel (have you seen one of those before, kid?) i recount my tale. 

after my first drink (a FANTASTIC margarita, 200+ yelpers don't lie), i went back to the bar to order my second drink: a beer.  after a moment or two of pondering, i settled on a hell or high watermelon wheat. i was in the mood.

"ummmm, I'll have a hell or high watermelon, please!"
".......do you know what that is?"
"um, yep!" (smiles sweetly)
".....well, have you had it before?"
"ummmm yep!" (raises eyebrows expectantly)
silence while he (dare i say reluctantly?) fetches my beer.

third drink time. sure it's monday. sure i slammed two gin & t's at my neighborhood bar on my way here, and sure it's only 10, but it seems that that's just the kind of girl i am. back to the bar:

"ummm, i'll have two sierra nevadas, please"
at this point, he may not have in fact uttered "psh" but his face was, needless to say, nothing but "psh"
"(psh) you know what that is, right?"
"??????????????????"
at this point, i believe i may have laughed.
now, to his credit, what they had on tap was the sierra nevada wheat, and not the perhaps more typical pale ale. but, nonetheless. are. you. kidding. me.

what there is to learn from this (besides that i say "umm" a lot and that i drink what is probably more than a little too heavily on weeknights) is that you shouldn't come here if you're feeling testy, or if you're sick of being treated like an idiot everywhere you go, or if you're not here with someone who'll laugh it off with you and confirm that he, and not in fact you, is the one acting less than decorously.

if (d) none of the above: you're golden.
author: Devin F.

description: A set of old marquee lights above and to the left of the bar spells out S-I-N. Do I really have to say another damn word about this place?
author: Michael E.

description: The last time I was here was 10 years ago, before the big tech boom drove me out of the Mission.  I was pleased to see that it hadn't really changed.  It's a great little dive bar, but watch out for the margaritas -- they pack a serious wallop.
author: Andi T.

description: Was at the LA last night and noticed they had like 200% more chairs on the floor.  I figured someone must have read my review.  You're welcome to everyone who was enjoying sitting down last night.
author: Kevin H.

description: I've never been here for more than two or three drinks, but every time has been utterly enjoyable.  Very laid back, very chill, very relaxed, and good drinks.  I love the inside, especially the pinatas hanging from the ceiling.  I also love the tapas bar across the street, Esperpento (get the patatas bravas!), dinner at which usually precedes drinks at Latin America club.
author: Jenna H.

description: Oh lordy, the reviews were right...the drinks were strong! I'd been drinking sapphire tonics all throughout the night before wandering in here (I was confused by the neon horsehoe sign as the only business sign out front) and ordered another one here. The price can't be beat at 5.50 because it tasted like a full glass of gin with a 'breath' of tonic. I definitely took my time with this one. The place was packed and the bar itself had a mishmash of interesting decor from pinatas hanging overhead to a giant hamster looking thing on the wall to glowy red neon lights that reads SIN on the other wall. Had a good time here even though I wussed out and didn't finsh my drink!
author: kristin e.

description:
Sin is always in 
With pint size margaritas
Revolving art work
author: HaikuReview X.

description: My favorite bar. Sunday, Monday, Tuesday nights.  The verticality of the space and the booths in the shop-like windows make this dive my home away from home. The only thing that makes me sad is that they often run out of my favorite bar scotch - oban.  Don't ever go on Thu., Fri. or Saturday. It's awful and too crowded with a crowd that doesn't live in the hood. I like my  dive bars to function as my  local joint, t.y.!
author: Maïa Cybelle C.

description:
"My Dad Comes Into Town For Business With Some Friends and then Proceeds to Drink Me Under the Table" Part 3

I have a love-hate relationship with hanging out in the Mission.  And by "love-hate" I mean "pretty much hate, but I have to go there so often because that's where everything/everyone is so I convince myself there is some love there just so I don't have to hate myself too terribly but it can be hard to sleep at night sometimes I won't lie to you."  The Latin American Club, however, fits more into the category of "bar I hate to love" as opposed to "bar I love to hate."  It can get horribly crowded so sometimes the idea of going here makes me cringe, but as far as the Mission goes (which is ALWAYS too crowded on weekends) I've actually had decent luck here.  And especially if you're able to grab a table, you're set.  The decor is a ridiculous hodgepodge of hanging things, the crowd is diverse, but mostly young and hip, you almost always overhear some hilarious conversation in line for the bathroom, drinks are decently priced and they aren't stingy with the booze.  I HATE TO ADMIT IT, but I think this is actually one of the few places in the City that I've been to a bunch and still managed to never have a bad time which is REALLY hard for me as I can be hard to please and like to make things difficult for myself - just ask any of my exes! (please don't.)

So when my dad was in town with his friends and the new boy had just met up with us at Kezar's and my dad's friend Andre is all "SHOW US WHERE THE ACTION AT" and I'm all "BITCHES CAN YOU HANDLE THE ACTION????" because I am pretty drunk at this point, what with company picnic plus baseball game plus two rounds of drinks and two rounds of shots with my DAD (don't forget that part) and all, not that I need an excuse to talk like a sailor in front of my dad, though he'd probably prefer that I "watch [my] f***ing mouth" (GOD we think we're SO FUNNY (SH*T I lost track of where this sentence needs to end!))

ANYWAY so there is a resounding "yes" to the question of being able to handle it, so we get in the boy's car (he's a trooper/keeper let me tell you!) and go to the Latin American.  This is where things get a little fuzzy for me, but I remember we got a table, got some good drinks, my dad and the boy tried to sing a Bob Dylan and Johnny Cash duet except the boy couldn't remember the words but that was fine my dad was too busy doing his terrible/fantastic Johnny Cash impersonation to probably notice anyone else, Andre made some more friends most likely, Geoff by this point was just laughing, I might have been asleep on the table - GOOD TIMES.  As per usual.  

ANYWAY, in addition to just being solid, I have to thank the Latin American for really saving my ass in the eyes of my father and his friends who after the Alembic debacle and the mediocre bar experience of Kezar's might have been starting to think that I am uncool.  The Latin American redeemed my image in the eyes of my father AND pushed me just over that edge of drunkenness for the evening such that I was able to trip on the sidewalk and end up with a bloody knee - my life and family are awesome!

Woohoo!  As good as it gets!

For the Mission.
author: Ashley B.

description: I can't figure out why this bar is so successful and is always packed to the brim with thirsty hipsters looking for a good time.  There's nothing really special about this bar except it has a nice location.  Drink prices are average, bartenders are ok, space is dim but typical...so, I'm just going to assume that there is a secret opium den in the back that draws the crowds...that, or the owners have NKOTB tied up and signing autographs!  Oh!  No wonder why there are so many people at this bar all the freakin' time!  It's Jordan, Jon, Danny, Donnie and Joey...I get it now!
author: Tabatha Y.

description: After escaping from the SoCal scene that is  Medjool was totally refreshed by this place. Nice, random Bay Area crowd and decor.  People were mingling and having  good times. Ordered 2 rounds of drinks with friends, bartender number one was kinda cranky because I asked for water after she poured up the drinks which was kinda baffling...her tap was right there :( (Otherwise this place would have 5 stars). The second round, the other bartender was really nice and poured us generously stiff drinks. I shall return...
author: Allisoto P.

description:
heavy hands pour generous amounts of grey goose.
the gerbil gives me a friendly wink.
the pink power ranger pinata approvingly gazes upon me.
a black and white dog trots past me.
a man does a trick w/his hat.
cuckoo clocks argue about the correct time.

(i like me a little weird, and a whole lotta goose.)
author: Ting A.

description: I really don't like this bar which puts me in the minority here but I have always found major attitude with the bartenders and a very uncomfortable space. The only reason I give it two stars is because of  the decor. Other than that, no reason to come here. Probably doesn't help I once had a very uncomfortable date here once, huh?
author: Maria D.

description: Though the drinks are supposed to be a good value here, I just find the place to be a bit of a downer. Thats just my take, others seem to like it a lot more, so perhaps its worth checking out yourself.
author: Vivek N.

description: Great neighborhood bar!  Yaaay Latin America Club!  A pint of Sierra Hefeweizen is only $3!  My friend ordered an Anchor, which I think came out to only $4.  The bartenders are really cool and friendly, and I love that though this place gets pretty packed as the night goes on, you can still have a conversation w/o screaming.  If you're a Missionite or happen to be in the area, I think this bar is a great place for any crowd.
author: Swetha G.

description: It's always nice when the bar the crowd is meeting up at happens to be in your neighborhood. I got lucky like that this week when Latin American Club was chosen. It was Saturday night, so the place got pretty packed, but we got there just in time to secure a table for what turned out to be about ten of us. After reading some of the other reviews I am not sure if I am happy or disappointed that I stuck to beer instead of cocktails. I sort of think I might have to tempt fate and go back for a margarita.
author: J F.

description:
its  a so so bar with friendly bartenders and a good vibe for the most part,
they were out of the big daddy ales when i went though, which i can say was the only bad thing. id like to go back when theres a little more people but every time i go it seems a little not so lively. The night i did leave however as i was walking out some dude let me drive his golf cart electric vehicle type thing which was the cherry on top of the whole night. definitely made my night, should i have driven as drunk as i was???? probably not. but hey. it happens
author: Kevin M.

description: Awesome decor, and really friendly bartenders. It seems like a place I would like to drink at, but good luck hanging out there on the weekend. We stayed for one very, very cramped drink, then fought our way through the crowd to the fresh air outside. I will have to revisit this place on a weekday trip.
author: Tori B.

description: I imagine I'm not much of a "Mission" guy, but as it's one of the "cool" neighborhoods in SF, I tend to find myself here on many a night during my visits here.  I came with a few members of Team CM who weren't ready to call it a night after dinner.  I'll echo Nish on the strong drinks - many points there.  But I don't know - yeah, there's pinatas and a giant hamster cut out, but other than that, I found this place rather unremarkable.  I did get into a big, rather heated debate about the importance of voting, and perhaps freaked out a few of my co-workers (what can I say, I'm a passionate guy).    I'm sure on the right night, this could be fun, but the random Tuesday we went did not impress.
author: Sam P.

description: One of my favorite spots to grab a low-key drink in the Mission.  Good bartenders, a cool crowd, interesting art on the walls and lots of tables to sit at.  Doesn't get too packed and the vibe is laid back and unpretentious.
author: Andrew E.

description: I am so tired of you getting me drunk and taking advantage of me. You know I'm not much of a drinker anymore, and those late nights are killing me. My boyfriend is getting suspicious. I heart you Latin American Club.
author: J. R.

description: I heart this bar.  Not scene-y at all, always room to sit and easy ambi.
author: Shan K.

description:
one morning i woke up and couldn't remember getting home (and later learned that, after walking/stumbling home, i let a friend borrow my flipflops, which i spent hours trying to find before concluding i lost them).  i thought (with only a slight headache to impede the cognitive process), i didn't have that much to drink last night.  then i remembered, i had two margaritas at the latin american and then some of a friend's margarita and some of her boy's margarita.

the tastiest margarita ever.  and strong.  very strong
author: d p.

description: A really just fine-ass bar in the Mission. Which is getting rarer.
author: patrick g.

description: Ok, so as others have pointed out, this place is neither Latin nor a club.  But what's in a name? This place is a great little spot for catching up with friends DURING THE WEEK. Weekends can get obnoxious. As many others have mentioned, it gets crowded so be prepared to leave with battle wounds from being elbowed or having your drink spilled.  The decor in this place is what makes this place so unique. Gone are most of the creepy dolls, so now it's mostly strange odds and ends hanging from the walls and ceilings.
author: SL N.

description: Uninspired space with inattentive bartenders. Trying to shoot pool here is like masturbation with a chain-mail glove. The  last two times I made the mistake of allowing myself to be dragged here, the spot, (to quote Laura B.) was teaming with "Bitches I hate". They can keep it!
author: Mingus R.

description: I'm pretty sure this bar is too old for me.. but I dont really care, I only go when no one else is in there, anyway! The decor is kind of like... someone decorated for a birthday party in the 50s and no one ever bothered to redecorate. Although I count "ridiculously small" as a plus when describing bars, I dont feel claustrophobic in Latin American Club at all. At a whopping 2 blocks from my house, I cant really say no.. to the booze
author: katharine s.

description: Love this place!  And true story about the margaritas: strong and delish!  We went on a Tues night so it wasn't too busy--I've heard it can get pretty crowded on the weekends.  I loved that there was a golden retriever at the bar....
author: Britta D.

description: The dramatic jumbo-sized chihuahua artwork. High-hanging festive pinatas adorning the ceiling. A noose with a plastic alligator hanging above the bar. Then you have the giant neon horseshoe sign above the entrance. Not sure what each of these symbolizes. It's overwrought, but then again it IS the best ambiguously Latin American bar in the Mission. What'd make it really cool would be if they etched the Nazca Lines on the floor for added kitsch. The selection for the beer on tap is somewhat limited.
author: Chris C.

description: not a whole lot to add to what other people have said. yes, the margaritas are ridiulously strong, and a great way to start (or guarantee an early end to) your night. i rarely stay here for too too long though because of how crowded it gets
author: Mark A.

description:
if you were there yesterday night (9.9) and saw the obnoxiously smashed guy at  the bar, yeah he was a friend of mine. happy birthday james!

anyway... its small, hot, dim, crowded, not really a club, and the only things latin american in the place were a few pinatas and my friend mike chavez who showed up late. but because of reasonably priced and unreasonably strong drinks, this place makes me smile, my liver cry, and nights pretty fun.
author: N. B. K.

description: Okay so I am totally not a hipster by any stretch of the imagination.  But I felt totally relaxed and had a great time at this place!  The decor is off the wall with the giant pictures of chihuahuas and the pinatas all over the place!  If you are in this area you should definitely check out this bar!
author: Johnnie T.

description: Kitsch everywhere. No need to drum up a conversation topic, I just find myself trying to count the marshmellow peeps.  Can you say "Cheap date"?  A few less people would be an improvement, but I complain about this at every place I like.
author: Beth V.

description: Great bar with a relaxed atmosphere, nice staff, fun crowd, and a couple of tables out front where you can sit with your drink and have a smoke.
author: Max E.

description: First things first: Latin American Club is neither Latin American nor a club.  And don't let the horseshoe sign fool you either.  No, the Latin American club is simply a quintessential, no-frills Mission hipster bar. Combine it with The Attic and Doc's Clock to get a perfect trifecta of hipster goodness. The centrally located pool table is a nice touch.
author: Wes M.

description: Total misnomer -- I really have seen nothing Latin at all at this bar!  That said, I generally have a good time here.  Weekends can be overly crowded and there's nothing particularly outstanding about the place, but it's comfortable, there's a pool table, and somehow, you always end up running into a friend here.
author: Sid D.

description: This is where I'll be during the Apocalypse, drinking a vodka gimlet.  I'll be watching the marshmallow Peeps driving their Peep-sized convertible on the mantle behind the bar.  Those funny Peeps.  When the Lord finally shows up I'll order a margarita that's worthy of Him.  Sure, the world's about to end, but there's cuckoo clocks up on the walls, stiff drinks, and Peeps behind the bar.  This place is great.
author: Phil D.

description: Went back a few times and the new bartender was not there. The margaritas were back to being as good as ever. The scary guy bartender never uses enough lime, but other than that, it's the same old great experience it always was. Love the LAC!
author: Alice H.

description: Great place to hang out, grab a drink, and talk with friends.  Very casual, hip mission bar.
author: John F.

description: I would love to know the history of this place. it is immediately comfortable and has suprisingly good wine for a bar-bar. great place to go before dinner at Dosa around the corner! ;)
author: Gretchen T.

description: When I first moved to San Francisco someone told me that singer/song writer Mark Eitzel hung out here and so I began to stake out the place. It took about three weeks, but sure enough he showed up one night and I bought him a drink. Years later, it's still one of my favorite bars -- no one can beat the kitchy decour, like the poster on alcoholism and the flashing SIN sign over the doorway -- and the drinks are STIFF.
author: Katie B.

description: Reasonably cool place, and it's only a block away!
author: Don H.

description: If you enjoy drinking strong pint glass margaritas while looking at a giant hamster or a decapitated baby doll this is the place for you. I love going here for drinks with friends after work or before hitting up a long night of drinking in the Mission. They usually play chill good tunes and there is the Godfather table in the back where you can people watch on a crowded night.
author: Katie M.

description: Easily missed when ambling through the mission.  High ceilings are dotted with hanging pinatas of all shapes.  A bit understaffed with just two bartenders on a Saturday night.  Fair drink prices, greyhound + vodka martini = $9, though the cooler glass for my drink was a bit on the anorexic side.  Took awhile to figure out where to pee, no signage above either bathroom door.  Apparently taggers have attacked nearly every square inch of both.
author: Sam N.

description: Great bar for a weeknight.  Strong drinks.  Cool, funky interior.
author: Kelly H.

description:
painfully strong margaritas should be the first thing you think of cause that is why i like to go here. on the nights i don't want my mind totally erased the beer selection does me just fine.

its just a great place to meet friends relax and actually hear them while you have a conversation.
author: Chris G.

description: I really like this place. Don't like their cocktails though - but if I am in the mood for a beer in the mission, it certainly seems my #1 choice - even though, the male bartender that works there is pretty much always unfriendly and has yet to crack a smile.
author: M J.

description: Wow this place is FUN(ky). The crowd is usually diverse and fun-loving, but strangely not very Latin American as the name would suggest. Don't come here of you want a conversation. Great place to dance your a** off...
author: Natalie T.

description: Well, I'm a latecomer, as I only found this bar a handful of months ago, but it definitely pops in my mind whenever I'm going out for drinks in my hood.  And I haven't been on the weekends - Thursday night is the closest I've gotten - the week night vibe fit my bill for a place I can sit down, have a brew (or strong drink - usually anyway), chat it up with a friend or two in a space that is big enough and filled up enough that there is some bustle and "life" around you..
author: Eric H.

description: Margaritas big, but not as good as I was expecting.  Good crowd.
author: Peter O.

description: I'm with Nish. Tip: top-shelf whiskey is stupid cheap.
author: Blaine C.

description: A pretty good bar, very cheap alcohol.
author: Alban D.

description: This is a total neighborhood bar... some of the best times i have had in SF had been on a random weeknight here.  They have a pool table which gets some use on the weekends - be careful for the random stick in the ribs though!  Try the tasty martini - so good.
author: Annabel G.

description: I heart going out in the Mission and I heart this place. I love how relaxed this is as well as the delicious beverages. Try the margs...fantab. It's also a great place to people watch...it's in the Mission...so you probably already knew that. hot damn, a great place.
author: Natalie C.

description: Eye Candy... and I'm not talking about the people!  I could stare at the walls for hours.  I think I did.
author: Mara H.

description: This place is weird but the drinks are good. I have this sneaking suspicion that it may be cooler than I think it is but I can't tell. People really seem to back it, where as I think it is so so.
author: Roxane S.

description: Pretty cool, laid back spot.
author: Anita C.

description: Three words: giant hamster cutout. The giant hamster is crucial to understanding the overall Latin America Club experience. While it might be random, it is surely awesome. I love sipping on a drink, gazing at the hamster and wondering why? I suppose it doesn't matter why... What matters is it's there.
author: C P.

description: fun, noisy, hipster galore and dank. smells like someone mopped the floor with beer and piss, however, that doesn't stop me from getting plastered on their fine booze. bartenders sure know how to make a man happy. please go and join the part-ay!
author: S. G.

description: I read the reviews but was skeptical; no, it's official: the drinks here are deadly.  Yow, win for all.
author: Jack H.

description: I really dig this place, and not only because it's two blocks away from my house. The interior is somehow kind like a reverse tardis... looks huge, but there's barely any room inside, especially once people start filing in after work. Kinda dirty, pretty cool, great drinks, laid back vibe. One or two of the bartenders are kind of a bummer, but it doesn't matter after your third drink.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Aside from the awesome decorations and of course the prime location, which in and of themselves would be enough to hang out here regularly, the drinks are also inexpensive and well made. They have a monstrous margarita that will knock your sox off. But its also just a great spot to hang with friends, before, after or even during a meal (they never complain when I bring a quesadilla suiza over from farolito to enjoy with my massive margarita). Its no wonder I'm there so often!
author: Kai H.

description: I had a great time at this bar.  It was a rainy Saturday, late afternoon, and I stopped in to wait out the rain and have a beer.  The bar tender was really nice and friendly, and he helped me and my friend get our holiday drink fix on (think Kahlua, Baileys, etc.).  Great selection, great prices, even for MY wallet, and cool decor.  The vibe was mellow, 30'sish in a good way (ie. not 21-ish or hipster-ish), and just what we were looking for.  I'll be going back f-sho!
author: Sarah H.

description: Drinks are strong.  Pool table makes it crowded.  Bathrooms are narsty.
author: Megan G.

description: The Latin America Club is jolly good fun.  They make super stiff drinks (especially the margaritas, which are quite delicious), but the beer selection is absolute crap and they don't give you straws with your cocktails (I heard the owner is a huge environmentalist and doesn't like the waste, but I think the custeromer should at least have the option for a straw with his or her drink).  There are a lot of tables and neat stuff to look at on the walls, all pluses.  Not the greatest bar in the world, but definetely worth checking out if you're in the neighborhood.
author: MonkeyPants S.

description: Maybe it's the giant chihuahua  paintings. Or the cutout 8 foot mouse. Or the pinatas hanging from the ceiling. Or the short stumble home. Whatever the case, the Latin American Club is simple, noisy and fun.
author: Gabriel W.

description: It's a great place to meet up with your friends for happy hour.  You can find some place to sit, it's not super loud and the margaritas are freaking strong.  Don't expect to have more than two if you're thinking you can walk straight afterwards.
author: Mabelle A.

description: This is an almost perfect neighborhood bar. Strong drinks, very heavy shoot pours and I mean very heavy. In fact I would recommend shying away from doing shoots there at all unless you have a strong desire to fall down or vomit outside as I have been a witness to these occurrences there. The only downside is there wine selection sucks and that is usually my poison of choice. Love the decor. I do however have secret fantasies of ripping apart all of the pinatas. shh... don't tell anyone.
author: Eryn L.

description: I like this place.  Great bloody mary's, friendly bartenders, cool decor, fairly mixed crowds.  Well, relatively mixed.  I always think it's a little funny that it's one of the whitest crowds I've seen in a bar in the Mission, but varies in age and scene enough to not turn me off to it.
author: Jett S.

description: this bar is the answer to the insufferable bits of the mission. reading the woohoos and woes of other patrons, i felt compelled to give you my love for this favored joint. john, a bartending staple as long as i've been going, is the kind of guy to say it to you straight. don't expect him to woo you. expect him to give you a stiff drink. if your lucky, he'll learn your name in a few years. in a world of instant friends, you can't help but love a fella who's discerning. you've read about the marges. you come here because this place is an inspiration and it isn't trying to charm you or play you or be cooler than you. it is just itself. the perfect place to write a long letter over a bourbon, watching the last light on the *sin* sign fade.
author: Allyson S.

description:
you will most likely drunk leave here.**
hiccup.


Tips and facts:
-Carb it up before entering
-Cash only
-$4 well/tonic
-Lesbigay and/or hipster crowd (duh.)
-Almost always at least one group of lost foreigners and/or businessmen that somehow managed to migrate from their hotel downtown and are still looking to score. (should have stayed downtown, buckos)
-You may not be able to move your elbows on a Saturday night
-You may not be able to go into work the next morning
-Good place to start and sustain a night out



**Please note I have never left drunk from The Latin American Club because I am a classy, classy lady. :)
author: A W.

description: Does a good job keeping away the riff-raff and people who want to try and play a serious game of pool in a bar that's about 20 feet by 20 feet. Continuously average, which is nice.
author: Andrew L.

description: I looked for a broom to hit the pinatas hanging from the ceiling the whole time. good music and a fun mix of people drinking away their wednesday night.
author: David F.

description: Haven't been here in awhile, but I liked that it was a happy crowd with minimal creepiness. No ass grabbing or unwelcome chit chat, it was purely music and yummy drinks. Surprisingly enough, girls in line for the bathroom were very pleasant; it's nice to finish a good long pee without some chick banging on the door and demanding that you hurry the fuck up.
author: Laura S.

description:
This spot has VERY strong drinks.
So if you like em stiff this is where you should go.

I go here while I'm doing laundry next door.

I actually don't really understand the draw to this place, sometime its extremely packed for no real reason. 

Mostly it's large groups that visit this place on the weekends and smaller groups on the weekdays.
author: Henry C.

description: Beer, pool, whiskey... what else you need in a local watering hole?
author: Joe L.

description: The LAC is amongst one of the raddest and funkiest spots in the city for a weeknight drink.  It does have some spatial issues - personally I think it could probably do without the pool table...but meh - whatever, it still rocks some radness.   I make it a point to drop in at least once a month, or whenever there's a rad show at the Make Out Room.
author: Ranch S.

description: The margaritas are amazing and at $7 you cannot beat that price. Be careful not to drink more than 2.
author: Bob M.

description: I really like this place! Relaxed and mellow if you get there before 9. It can get pretty crowded latter though. Try the Heradura Margarita! Wow!
author: Heidi C.

description: I can't believe it took me so long to find this place.  The drinks are dee-lish, especially margaritas and manhattans.  It is a great place to chat with new and old friends during the week and gets super lively on weekends.  Whoever decorated the place is either a genius, insane or both!  My favorite SF bar.
author: Jen H.

description: This is what the mission used to be all about. Cheap drinks that are strong, friendly, efficient service (though new york like in attitude). Large selection of drinks. Excellent place.
