Music is not loud most nights so you can hear yourself talk. Great spot for just hanging with friends.
author: Jon S.

description: What a crappy little dive bar.  Don't get me wrong, I love dive bars, and I'm sure I could like this place, except that apparently you have to know the bartender to get a drink here.  If not, she can't be bothered to serve you.  My advice?  Skip it.  You're in the Mission.  There are plenty of other places.
author: Grace O.

description:
i hate this place.  it is pretentiously hipster--it's like "we're going to be totally minimalist, and by minimalist i mean horrible.."  my friend was feeling sick and wanted a coke-yeah, just a soda.  the bartender said "we don't have coke."  i said "do you have another cola?" she said "no." finally i got her a nasty moldy tasting water and asked for a straw.  "we don't have straws."

new low.
author: K H.

description: damn did i get f-upped on friday with a good start here at this bar.  when the bartender told me it was $10 for my margarita, i winced, ouch!  $10??!!  but i think that was all i needed to be well on my way...good beers, the time flew by.
author: Emilio O.

description: very strong pint-sized margaritas- whats not to love about this place,  well, some of the crowd some times but it's great vibes and nice tunes and strong drinks.
author: Chris D.

description: The bartender was super rude.  I really cannot stand that.  I'm just never going back.  She actually ripped the money out of my hand when I was asking her how much it was.
author: Dronic D.

description: this bar rocks. not too much of one kind of crowd, strong-ass drinks and just enough dive to feel at home. great people watching from the tables in the front windows, both in the bar and out on the street. yea for the latin!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: holy chihuahuas! latin american club has the most menacing chihuahuas i've ever seen in my life. they're about ten feet tall! it's no surprise that such mutants call latin american club their home. this really is a great neighborhood bar. the only downside is that they only serve four or five beers. um, what's up with that? a true watering hole should have at least twenty. no, i don't want a margarita or cocktail. too sweet. i just want some mexican or euro trash beer. you don't have them? ok, i suppose i can settle for a plain old ketel one with a twist.
author: frisco j.

description: An excellent bar. Loses one star as I wish the beer selection were a bit more interesting (Leffe, Scrimshaws?) and they have one awful bartender (amongst many other good ones) who patently ignores customers while chatting to friends... and sh'e been there years!?
author: Matt E.

description: I love the Margarita Man.  OMG like a liter of tequila.  The place is cool: high ceilings and pinatas hanging and dog paintings on the walls.  You can also bring your dog (a huge plus).  Outdoor seating for nice days.  No one spilled anything on me so I am a fan.
author: Josh S.

description: not that a tuesday is the best night to rate a bar, but i was not impressed.  kind of dead, and no fun music that i could hear.  i did get a kick out of the fact that when i ordered my prosecco (NOT the type of drink to order in a bar like this, but i had already had a few glasses of wine at dinner and didnt want to mix it up), it came with a champagne goblet and a mini-bottle!  too funny!  i would go back and give this place another chance though.
author: Carolyn B.

description: love this place, just gets so packed. stiff drinks are great. giant animal heads with eyes x-ed out...hm.
author: R J.

description: fun, noisy, hipster galore and dank. smells like someone mopped the floor with beer and piss, however, that doesn't stop me from getting plastered on their fine booze. bartenders sure know how to make a man happy. please go and join the part-ay!
author: ray c.

description: hi, i got totally f*ed up here on one margarita. yes, did you know they made margaritas?? this place is low-key and a great week-night drinking establishment.
author: eve l.

description: pretty chill dive and a very mixed crowd, which i like. the decor is always a great topic of conversation. pool table is small, and it sucks b/c its practically pushed up against a wall. cheap drinks ... yes!
author: Jeanne F.

description: drinks are strong as all hell. this place is fun, dark and dangerous (in the you might get way more wasted than you had planned sort of way). excellent place to get some cocktails before you wander across the street to esperpento to top off your latin lover night.
author: Amy P.

description: this place is suh-wheat! divey, hip, but not too cool for school. great place for a group of friends to drink and talk - you can actually hear each other.
author: Charmagne L.

description: One of my favorite Mission bars.  Always an interesting mix of people, good drinks, lots of accidental and unavoidable body contact, fun times all around.  Plus, the decor is just fucking great.
author: Claire C.

description: The stout's good, but if you're in this part of the Mission, I'd recommend Revolution up the street instead (half a block towards Mission). You'll certainly get something faster -- we were pretty much lepers most of the time we were at Latin American.
author: Bob B.
